attributes.title: WTF Are NFTs? Part 1
attributes.description: NFTs are taking over the world. From fine art to digital collectibles and virtual land, NFTs are everywhere. But what exactly are they and how can you, as a creator, use them? In this two part workshop we‚Äôll explore the basics of NFTs; what they are, the technology that powers them and how you can make your own.

copy.heading: About Tom
copy.content:
Tom Glendinning is a content creator, multi-disciplinary artist and educator. He creates content for music makers as ELPHNT (where he has over 70k YouTube subscribers) and has been teaching Ableton Live as an Ableton Certified Trainer for 10+ years.
Tom creates digital art and explores web3 under the Polyforms alias. He is also member of Playgrounds - a community of creators building at the forefront of web3 and crypto.

copy.heading: This Session
copy.content:
NFTs are taking over the world. From fine art to digital collectibles and virtual land, NFTs are everywhere. But what exactly are they and how can you, as a creator, use them?

In this two part workshop we‚Äôll explore the basics of NFTs; what they are, the technology that powers them and how you can make your own. Part 1 will look at the fundamentals; what NFTs are and how they work. In Part 2, you‚Äôll learn how to create your own NFTs and we‚Äôll dive deeper into some of their many uses like digital art and music, collectibles and more.

attributes.title: Career Change: a Self-Reinvention
attributes.description: This workshop is a take on how to navigate a career reorientation to the arts and the things Arash wish he knew before taking the leap of faith years back. In a friendly conversational format, you‚Äôll review the challenges that Arash personally went through as well as some case studies of other successful cases.

copy.heading: About Arash
copy.content: Paris-based Art Director and Concept Artist, Arash Razavi, has been in the Film and Game industry since 2016, in full-time freelance and also in-house positions. Following several years as an art educator, he went on to obtain a Master's degree in concept art from the Newedge Art Center in Paris. He has collaborated with a colorful array of companies, from Netflix, Submarine Animation, Riot Games, Innogames, to Savage interactive (Procreate) and Mathematic Studios. Prior to his art career, he was a biomedical scientist in Ultrasound Therapy for over a decade, working in international research centers and hospitals in Germany, France, and the Netherlands. While this former career proved an invaluable life experience, the real excitement started when he took the leap of faith to align his career with his burning passion in 2016. And since then he‚Äôs never looked back.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: This workshop is a take on how to navigate a career reorientation to the arts and the things Arash wish he knew before taking the leap of faith years back. In a friendly conversational format, you‚Äôll review the challenges that Arash personally went through as well as some case studies of other successful cases.

attributes.title: An Intro to 3D (for Photographers, Stylists and Art Directors)
attributes.description: A workshop with Ben showing you how to take practical, real world skills into the digital realm. This will take place in Cinema 4D and Redshift, but the skills shown can apply to any 3D software or rendering engine.

copy.heading: About Ben
copy.content: A digital commercial artist, working on Wurundjeri land. Benjamin studied Media Arts in Hamilton, New Zealand (Aotearoa) before moving to Melbourne (Naarm), Australia. He worked at VICE Asia-Pacific as the Head of Art for over a decade, a role which covered pretty much every visual discipline. Now he's out on his own, where he splits his time between working as a freelance creative and creating his own digital art. He's always been interested in the tension, or the grey murky areas between ideas, whether it's the push and pull between Utopia and Dystopia, or sneaking Fast & Furious References into high-concept interiors.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: A workshop with Ben showing you how to take practical, real world skills into the digital realm. This will take place in Cinema 4D and Redshift, but the skills shown can apply to any 3d software or rendering engine. Guiding how knowledge of setting up lights, blocking and styling can apply in a 3D world, and how this is more important than any hardcore software knowledge.

Part 2 of this series builds on the basics covered in Part 1. You‚Äôll learn how to set up a crypto wallet and make your own NFTs. We‚Äôll also dive deeper into the many uses of NFTs for digital art and music, collectibles and more.

attributes.title: 3D Motion Design: Commercials
attributes.description: In this session with George, you‚Äôll explore his 3D motion design¬†process in commercials. He‚Äôll do a deep dive into some techy Y2K shots he created for a Deutsche Telekom commercial featuring Billie Eilish. From Tony Hawk's Pro Skater characters, face filters and 80's hacker graphics... it's going to be good! George will also discuss his overall post-production workflow using C4D and After Effects, plus touch on some additional ideas about leading and working within teams of artists.

copy.heading: About George
copy.content:
After quitting his BA in Illustration at the University of Brighton in 2015, George stumbled into the freelance creative world. Initially, taking on whatever jobs came his way, he worked as an illustrator, graphic designer, photographic assistant, editor, club promoter, and West Ham FC/Monster Energy human-merch-mannequin, before finally settling as a motion designer; teaching himself 2D & 3D technical skills entirely through Youtube. Working remotely at first with independent production companies through word-of-mouth, he eventually took the plunge and approached some creative studios, which led him to an internship-come-lead-motion-designer (over the space of almost 3 years) at the Electric Theatre Collective, ETC VFX.

Now leading his own studio, Greedy Goons, George divides his time in between creating commercial motion design and directorial projects within the music industry. Selected clients include: Adidas, Apple Music, Pepsi, Puma, EA, Ray-Ban, Sky, Sony Music & UMG.

Aside from creating and directing, George also works as a mentor, where he not only supports people with their technical skills, but also tries to demystify the visual creative industries to make them more accessible and ultimately, more fun.

copy.heading: The session
copy.content: In this session with George, you‚Äôll explore his 3D motion design¬†process in commercials. He‚Äôll do a deep dive into some techy Y2K shots he created for a Deutsche Telekom commercial featuring Billie Eilish. From Tony Hawk's Pro Skater characters, face filters and 80's hacker graphics... it's going to be good! George will also discuss his overall post-production workflow using C4D and After Effects, plus touch on some additional ideas about leading and working within teams of artists.

attributes.description: Telling a story on film isn‚Äôt just about recording the action. It‚Äôs also about how the images are captured. In the film and television world, this is known as cinematography. In this workshop, Jessy will break down the components of cinematography and its importance to filmmaking.

copy.heading: About Jessy
copy.content:
Jessy Moussallem is a storyteller whose iconic imagery is both authentic and necessary. Born and raised in Beirut, Jessy pursued her inclination for storytelling at the Lebanese Academy of Arts with her graduation film winning first prize at the European Film Festival.

Jessy‚Äôs work is characterised by the rich, intimate stories she tells, the craft she displays, and the emotion it elicits.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Telling a story on film isn‚Äôt just about recording the action. It‚Äôs also about how¬†the images are captured. In the film and television world, this is known as cinematography. Cinematography sets and supports the overall look and mood of a film‚Äôs visual narrative. Each visual element that appears on screen, a.k.a. The mise-en-sc√®ne of a film, can serve and enhance the story. In this workshop, you'll discuss why cinematography so important to filmmaking.

attributes.title: Ten Minute Poetry Challenge
attributes.description: During this workshop with Alieu, you‚Äôll be selecting a topic, structure and technique before seeing what you can come up with in a ten-minute poetry challenge. This practice can be used to get over writers' block, and to challenge your mind when being monitored or timed. You‚Äôll get your brain working, and the pen writing. No time to think, which means more time to write. Join this workshop to practice your writing skills under pressure.

copy.heading: About Alieu
copy.content:
Ali is a poet based in Denmark, however, was raised in London. He fell in love with poetry around the age of 10, whilst he was studying in secondary school.

He became addicted to writing poetry when he realised the way one poem could have a million different meanings through interpretation. Reading it differently you could have a million different perspectives, views and opinions about how it makes you feel. Since then he has used poetry as a way to express himself, as a medicine to a clogged up mind filled with thoughts and frustrations.

Two years ago, was the first time he performed in front of an audience. As much as it was a nerve-racking experience, his stage presence captivates audiences, leaving them entranced in his words. Since then, Ali has been invited to multiple events to perform his poetry, that often centres around self-expression, political insights and identity.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content:
During this workshop with Alieu, you‚Äôll be selecting a topic, structure and technique before seeing what you can come up with in a ten-minute poetry challenge.
This practice can be used to get over writers' block, and to challenge your mind when being monitored or timed. You‚Äôll get your brain working, and the pen writing. No time to think, which means more time to write. Join this workshop to practice your writing skills under pressure.

attributes.title: How To Stipple With Ink
attributes.description: Juliet will explain the basics of stippling with ink on paper. She‚Äôll start with a basic sketch, and show how she creates a finished piece through this specific style of illustrating.

copy.heading: About Juliet
copy.content: Juliet Schreckinger is a Long Island, NY based artist. Her work is typically created using a stippling technique in pen & ink and graphite, with occasional splashes of color. Juliet‚Äôs pieces are inspired by the ocean, nature, and all of the creatures within our world. Since the time she was a child, Juliet has been fascinated by black and white photography, colorless television shows, and film noir movies. Being exposed to the lighting effects and sharp contrasts shown in these photographs and films greatly inspired the type of work that she does today. Juliet‚Äôs work is centered around giving a voice to nature and animals, with the goal of showcasing their importance in this world. Through an illustrative take on fine art, she attempts to express a story in each drawing.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Juliet will explain the basics of stippling with ink on paper. She‚Äôll start with a basic sketch, and show how she creates a finished piece through this specific style of illustrating. She‚Äôll also share different tips and tricks of drawing in this style as well as what specific tools are best to use. This is an introductory workshop, anyone can join and learn the basics of stippling with ink!

attributes.title: How to Navigate the Songwriting Process
attributes.description: Debbie Knox-Hewson is joined by the multi-faceted songwriter July Jones. They will discuss writing sessions, songwriting cuts and things to consider when writing for other artists.

copy.heading: About Debbie
copy.content: Session drummer and clinician Debbie Knox-Hewson began her professional career in a whirlwind playing for popstar Charli XCX, who she has toured the world extensively, appearing on various television/festival slots such as: Glastonbury, Lollapalooza, Reading & Leeds, Saturday Night Live, The David Letterman Show, Radio 1 Live Lounge and the Official Olympic Opening Ceremony in London. In addition to her Charli XCX work, Debbie‚Äôs economical style has graced records and tours with bands such as James, Honeyblood, Clean Bandit, Rae Morris, Betsy and CuckooLander. Most recently, Debbie has been in Los Angeles, filming a Netflix Original documentary about the formation of her own band, Nasty Cherry, with whom she is exploring her songwriting and production skills.

copy.heading: About July
copy.content:
July is a Slovenian born, London-based queer artist, songwriter and producer with a unique and global outlook on sexuality, politics and mental health. Her richly diverse views on gay culture + mental health has had a huge impact on her musical and personal journey. She‚Äôs written for artists such as BTS, Charli XCX, Naughty Boy, Sigala, 1991, 99 souls, Brooke Candy, Girli and Zolita and so on. While writing and producing for other artists, July is currently focusing on her mixtape (album), which she is releasing on February 11th, 2022. 

At her heart, July is a true and very real artist, inspired by everything around her - people, anxiety and the queer community. She is open to everything, and places diversity at the heart of what she does. In doing so she makes music with the aim of pushing her artistry forwards at all times.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Debbie Knox-Hewson is joined by the multi-faceted songwriter July Jones. They will discuss writing sessions, songwriting cuts and things to consider when writing for other artists.

attributes.title: The Intersection of Photography & Cinema
attributes.description: A conversation on the intersection of photography and cinema. With Todd, you‚Äôll explore how these two mediums have informed and inspired the other throughout modern culture.

copy.heading: About Todd
copy.content:
Todd Cole is an internationally acclaimed photographer and filmmaker who lives and works in Los Angeles, California. His photographic work is suffused with the sun, ocean and dust-filled air of his environment, which he contrasts with the ephemeral and idiosyncratic nature of his subjects. The moments he captures are fleeting, candid, and tell a story of love and ennui, beauty and banality. This compelling visual style has made Todd a sought-after photographer in the fashion world, his images appearing in many international publications, including i-D, Purple, Self Service, POP, 032C, T Magazine, Vogue, The NY Times Style Magazine, The Fader, Art Review, and The Journal, among others. He has also published a photography book, I‚Äôm Yours To Keep (AndPress, 2012).

The strong storytelling instinct behind the photographic images inexorably led Todd back to film, where he plays with time and reality. Drawn in by the rich images and the spontaneous authentic-feeling performances, our perceptions are then turned on their heads by the introduction of something unexpected or even magical. In the trio of short films made in collaboration with the clothing label Rodarte, Todd blends high fashion with magical reality to critical acclaim. This Must Be the Only Fantasy (starring Elijah Wood) was voted the top fashion film of 2013 by Business of Fashion and received a People‚Äôs Choice Webby Award for Online Film & Video. The Curve of Forgotten Things (starring Elle Fanning) and Aanteni were screened at major international film festivals, including the AFI Film Festival in Los Angeles.

copy.heading: This Session
copy.content: A conversation on the intersection of photography and cinema. With Todd, you‚Äôll explore how these two mediums have informed and inspired the other throughout modern culture. You‚Äôll look at Cinema as a source of inspiration within one‚Äôs photography practice. Todd will also discuss navigating the present-day demand for both stills and motion on commercial and editorial shoots, and he‚Äôll share some real-world, practical advice on how to best deliver both.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: The Super Bowl is one of the most anticipated live events. Many watch because they‚Äôre a fan of the epic halftime performances by top musical artists. It takes a solid team of hardworking individuals to create such a large scale production and often, we only see the final product of a creator's vision. From brainstorming ideas and coming up with a theme to planning, rehearsing, changes, understanding trends and your audience, there's plenty that goes into it. Join Loli as she breaks down the process of creating live events using the Super Bowl halftime show as her main point of reference.

Most recently, Debbie has been in Los Angeles, filming a Netflix Original documentary about the formation of her own band, Nasty Cherry, with whom she is exploring her songwriting and production skills.

copy.heading: About Anna
copy.content: Anna Straker is a London based singer, songwriter & producer. She began her career singing backing vocals for Rudimental and Years & Years. Straker has performed in Japan as well as major festivals such as Glastonbury, Reading & Leeds and Bestival. She has constant support from BBC Introducing with radio plays from Annie Mac, Charlie Hedges and Jo Wiley. copy.heading: About Hannes
copy.content: Hannes van Eeden, also known as the Wandering Ambivert is from Cape Town, South Africa. His photography journey began in late 2013 with a Blackberry. He swapped a Samsung Galaxy S3 for his first DSLR which was an Olympus E-300. A year later, he bought a Nikon D3100 and 5 years after that he bought the camera he‚Äôd been dreaming about since he laid eyes on it, the Nikon D5300. His photography journey, has taught him one valuable lesson - the best camera is the one with you. For the past 2 years, he‚Äôs been sharing his creative experiences on his website with the goal to inspire other artists for in creative journeys.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content:
As a¬†creative, do you sometimes feel stuck, like you have nothing to create and don‚Äôt know what to do? Are you conscious of your goals but don‚Äôt have the motivation to start and/or continue?¬†You're not alone!¬†Whether you call this a creative block, writer's block, photographer‚Äôs block, or a mental block, they all stem from a lack of inspiration and motivation.

Join Hannes in this interactive workshop as he shares how to accept your process and keep pushing throughout your creative journey.¬†Hannes will also share some tips and tricks with participants who wish to share the ups and downs of their own creative journeys.

attributes.title: Introduction to Impasto Painting
attributes.description: In this workshop Angela will explain the basics of impasto painting, starting with the types of paint, mediums, and tools you can use. Impasto is a painting technique where paint is laid on a surface in thick layers, typically by using a palette knife or brush. She will share tips and tricks she has learned over the years, as well as create painting(s) for you to watch or follow along with her!

copy.heading: About Angela
copy.content:
Angela Wells is a multidisciplinary artist based out of British Columbia, Canada. Her work ranges from colourful impasto paintings to single line tattoos. She has been working as a full time artist for the last two years, and has recently been filming her impasto painting process to create short but captivating videos.

Her artistic process begins with drawing inspiration from the things around her; it can be as simple as a flower growing in her garden or as abstract as a feeling based on a memory. She enjoys using a lot of paint, layering it on canvas with palette knives and using piping bags to manipulate it like frosting.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: In this workshop Angela will explain the basics of impasto painting, starting with the types of paint, mediums, and tools you can use. Impasto is a painting technique where paint is laid on a surface in thick layers, typically by using a palette knife or brush. She will share tips and tricks she has learned over the years, as well as create painting(s) for you to watch or follow along with her!

copy.heading: Follow Along with Angela!
copy.content:
If you would like to follow along with Angela while she paints, these are the supplies recommended to have on hand! 

- Liquitex Basics Acrylic colors: Titanium White, Naphthol Crimson, Primary Yellow, Hooker‚Äôs Green Hue Permanent, Phthalocyanine Blue (or any brand of heavy/medium body acrylic paint in colors: white, red, yellow, green & blue)

- Liquitex Gloss Gel acrylic medium

- Palette knife/knives (It is recommended you start with the classic spade shape)

- Palette paper or palette

- 5" by 7" canvas or any size you are comfortable with

- Paper towel or rag

attributes.title: Should you go to Art School?
attributes.description: Join this workshop with Louis Bever as he discusses the ongoing debate amongst artists: should you go to art school?

copy.heading: About Louis
copy.content:
Born in Germany, and growing up in France and Italy, Louis moved to the UK from Milan to study Law. His Grandpa gave him his old 35mm Film Camera when he was 16. Years later, his parents then made a bet that if he got a 2:1 in Law, they would buy him a Leica. He now has a 2:1 and a Leica M6.

Louis enjoys documenting key issues that he‚Äôs truly passionate about. He‚Äôs spent the last few years creating series‚Äô that are dedicated to promoting men's mental health and normalising men speaking about their mental health with their friends and family. His ongoing 'Men-Tal Health' series included interviews and familiar faces from Actor Joe Gilgun to Danny Lomas. He's currently shooting a series documenting love and relationships across the UK.

The 25-year-old has been shooting fashion advertorials and editorials for the last two years, shooting on 35mm and medium format film. Louis finds it thoroughly enjoyable to explain how film works and the process behind film photography with clients.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Join this workshop with Louis Bever as he discusses the ongoing debate amongst artists: should you go to art school? He‚Äôll share his journey before and after art school. From the application process and picking the right school for you, to creating your portfolio and considering your finances. He'll also explore how to juggle your academic, personal and artist life.

attributes.title: Ink Stippling: Illustration Draw Along
attributes.description: Join this workshop with Juliet where she‚Äôll complete a small illustration showing exactly how she stipples in real-time to shade and create a final drawing. Feel free to follow along with her as she'll challenge you and share a few advanced tips, while still keeping it basic for those who are still new to the technique.

copy.heading: About Juliet
copy.content: Juliet Schreckinger is a Long Island, NY based artist. Her work is typically created using a stippling technique in pen & ink and graphite, with occasional splashes of color. Juliet‚Äôs pieces are inspired by the ocean, nature, and all of the creatures within our world. Since the time she was a child, Juliet has been fascinated by black and white photography, colorless television shows, and film noir movies. Being exposed to the lighting effects and sharp contrasts shown in these photographs and films greatly inspired the type of work that she does today. Juliet‚Äôs work is centered around giving a voice to nature and animals, with the goal of showcasing their importance in this world. Through an illustrative take on fine art, she attempts to express a story in each drawing.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Join this workshop with Juliet where she‚Äôll complete a small illustration showing exactly how she stipples in real-time to shade and create a final drawing. Feel free to follow along with her as she'll challenge you and share a few advanced tips, while still keeping it basic for those who are still new to the technique.

copy.heading: Materials Needed to Follow Along
copy.content:
- Paper: Ideally mix media paper

- Pen: Any felt-tip small pen would work, even something as simple as a common sharpie

- Pencils: Any typical pencil would work for this class, but ideally one that is between HB-8B

- Brush: Any cheap brush around 1/2 - 3 inches in width will be perfect (just for blending the graphite)

- Eraser: A retractable eraser with a fine point is recommended but any common eraser will work for this class

attributes.title: Inclusivity in Film
attributes.description: In this workshop with Tara, you'll explore what it means to be inclusive and how to incorporate it into your creative process.

copy.heading: About Tara
copy.content: Tara Aghdashloo is a writer and filmmaker born in Iran. She worked for nearly 10 years as a journalist, on a number of docs and doc-series for television (BBC, Channel 4), as well as publishing her essays, short stories, articles, and poetry (The Guardian, The New Inquiry, and others), focusing on Middle Eastern and international politics, culture, and women‚Äôs issues. In recent years she‚Äôs been writing, directing and producing independent films and docs, as well as music videos and commercials. Her first narrative short, The Ride, was commissioned by BFI and Canada Council for the Arts, and the support of Toronto Arts Council. She is now working on her first narrative feature supported by Telefilm Canada.

copy.heading: The Session

copy.heading: About Karen
copy.content: Do you have an account on a social platform? 95% chance that you will answer a resounding 'yes'. You unconsciously build your Personal Brand. Personal Branding Expert Karen Oldhoven is a speaker, moderator and has her own Personal Branding Agency. Enthusiastic whirlwind Karen advises and manages creative entrepreneurs and students to clarify and develop their Personal Brand, so that they feel more confident about their personality. The moment you, dear creator, know what you stand for, you deliver the right value to the person you do business with. Think of your future employer, customers and/or consumers. Karen has a background in media, starred in commercials, presented events and now speaks passionately about personal leadership, the era of human skills and personal development.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Do you use social media? Then you're branding your personality. As a working¬†creative, your personality is your trademark. Join personal branding expert Karen as she shares tips on how to better identify who you are, what you stand for and what your talents are, so that you are able to communicate more confidently. Once you've created your Personal Brand, your clients will know exactly what you do and most importantly what you have to offer.

attributes.description: In this workshop you‚Äôll learn how to engage and interact with communities on Discord and discover how to filter through the noise to have fun, make friends and grow your career.

copy.heading: About Tom
copy.content:
Tom Glendinning is a content creator, multi-disciplinary artist and educator. He creates content for music makers as ELPHNT (where he has over 70k YouTube subscribers) and has been teaching Ableton Live as an Ableton Certified Trainer for 10+ years.

Tom creates digital art and explores web3 under the Polyforms alias. He is also member of Playgrounds - a community of creators building at the forefront of web3 and crypto.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content:
Finding the right community is essential to building your career. Online communities come in many shapes and forms, but one tool that‚Äôs growing in popularity for organising and participating in communities is Discord.

Originally a tool for gamers to chat, Discord has grown into a powerful community organisation tool, but it can be uniquely overwhelming when you first jump in.

In this workshop you‚Äôll learn how to engage and interact with communities on Discord and discover how to filter through the noise to have fun, make friends and grow your career.

attributes.title: How to Create a Commissioned Project
attributes.description: Join photographer Sara Lorusso as she shows you how to collaborate with brands and create commissioned projects! She'll cover everything from proposing your ideas, approaching clients, preparing and delivering your presentation and of course, how to complete the final project.

copy.heading: About Sara
copy.content: Sara Lorusso was born in 1995 in the Emilia Romagna countryside, a region in the north of Italy. From an early age She was fascinated by nature and by the creatures that populated it, perhaps it is here that her passion for observing was born. Always interested in the role of womxn in today‚Äôs society, She likes to tell true stories of people who are close to her or even of people She has just met. Since the first approach with photography She has tried to spread a message of inclusion, human‚Äôs body has always been objectified and aestheticized. We must represent the reality in which we live, where perfection does not exist. I want gender equality. Through her photos She would like everyone to express the right to be ourselves. Her work has been published and exhibited both in Europe and internationally.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Join photographer Sara Lorusso as she shows you how to collaborate with brands and create commissioned projects! She'll cover everything from proposing your ideas, approaching clients, preparing and delivering your presentation and of course, how to complete the final project. During this workshop, Sara will show examples of brand¬†collaborations completed using her shared process. She'll also share some tips on how¬†to evaluate your own work in terms of time and costs.¬†It's often difficult for a freelancer to understand how much their work is worth, with¬†Sara, you'll try to understand it together.

attributes.title: Poetry Feedback
attributes.description: Looking to share your work with others? Join Ali in this workshop where participants will have the opportunity to share a piece of poetry or writing they‚Äôve been working on.

copy.heading: About Alieu
copy.content:
Alieu is a poet based in Denmark, however, was raised in London. He fell in love with poetry around the age of 10, whilst he was studying in secondary school.

He became addicted to writing poetry when he realised the way one poem could have a million different meanings through interpretation. Reading it differently you could have a million different perspectives, views and opinions about how it makes you feel. Since then he has used poetry as a way to express himself, as a medicine to a clogged up mind filled with thoughts and frustrations.

Two years ago, was the first time he performed in front of an audience. As much as it was a nerve-racking experience, his stage presence captivates audiences, leaving them entranced in his words. Since then, Alieu has been invited to multiple events to perform his poetry, that often centres around self-expression, political insights and identity.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Looking to share your work with others? Join Alieu in this workshop where participants will have the opportunity to share a piece of poetry or writing they‚Äôve been working on. They'll receive feedback from Alieu and the rest of the Daisie community. This workshop is a safe space to share your creative writing!

attributes.description: Come and try something new! Join Debbie Knox-Hewson and the ethereal sound healer, Sonia Kreitzer, as they hold space for you to set your intentions, finding focus and stillness in the creative chaos.

copy.heading: About Debbie
copy.content: Session drummer and clinician Debbie Knox-Hewson began her professional career in a whirlwind playing for popstar Charli XCX, who she has toured the world extensively, appearing on various television/festival slots such as: Glastonbury, Lollapalooza, Reading & Leeds, Saturday Night Live, The David Letterman Show, Radio 1 Live Lounge and the Official Olympic Opening Ceremony in London. In addition to her Charli XCX work, Debbie‚Äôs economical style has graced records and tours with bands such as James, Honeyblood, Clean Bandit, Rae Morris, Betsy and CuckooLander. Most recently, Debbie has been in Los Angeles, filming a Netflix Original documentary about the formation of her own band, Nasty Cherry, with whom she is exploring her songwriting and production skills.

copy.heading: About Sonia
copy.content: Sonia Kreitzer is a Los Angeles-based singer, songwriter, and soundhealer. She has released four full-length records under her project, ‚ÄúDoe Paoro,‚Äù and toured alongside artists such as The Gipsy Kings and Sylvan Esso. As a songwriter, she has written songs for many artists, including Peter, Bjorn & Jon and Monogem. Her music has been featured on NPR, BBC, Triple J radio and in films and television. Cumulatively, her music has over 25M streams across platforms. She believes in the power of music as a universal source of healing.

copy.heading: The Session

Join Debbie Knox-Hewson and the ethereal sound healer, Sonia Kreitzer, as they hold space for you to set your intentions, finding focus and stillness in the creative chaos. attributes.title: Creating An Effective Social Media Strategy
attributes.description: In this workshop with Christina, we'll review platforms like TikTok, Twitch, Instagram and discuss¬†how you can work smarter (not harder, ew) to create and sustain your most authentic online presence.

copy.heading: About Christina
copy.content: Christina Wolfgram is a sit-down comedian because she rarely stands up. Her signature comedy videos have been viewed over a billion times on Facebook and Instagram, most notably her Facebook Watch series, Christina Tried Her Best, which racked up over 100 million views in just one season. She has one whole Master‚Äôs in Professional Writing from USC and an on-going prescription for Lexapro, which she takes every morning. She‚Äôs a huge believer that daily creativity makes for a happier brain, so she also teaches writing workshops to help people find their most authentic voice. Most recently, Christina founded Crying is Cool, a store full of funny fashion for stylish sensitives. She also hosts Sobcast the Podcast, where she begs the question, ‚ÄúWhat even is mental health?‚Äù Christina has developed content for countless brands, including Zooey Deschanel‚Äôs HelloGiggles, Hello Kitty, Disney Broadway, Twitch, DragCon, The Calm App, and Lunette Period Cups. She lives in Portland with her perfect cat.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: As a creator, figuring out what kind of content to make and which social media platforms to post it on can be frustrating and inhibiting. It can feel like we need to change our art to make it "work" for social¬†media, but in fact, we should question how each platform¬†can work for us. In this workshop with Christina, we'll review platforms like TikTok, Twitch, Instagram and discuss¬†how you can work smarter (not harder, ew) to create and sustain your most authentic online presence.

attributes.title: How To Make A Storyboard For Film
attributes.description: In this workshop with Jessy, you‚Äôll learn what is a storyboard and why it is so important in the process of making a music video, commercial or a film.

copy.heading: About Jessy
copy.content:
Jessy Moussallem is a storyteller whose iconic imagery is both authentic and necessary. Born and raised in Beirut, Jessy pursued her inclination for storytelling at the Lebanese Academy of Arts with her graduation film winning first prize at the European Film Festival.

Jessy‚Äôs work is characterised by the rich, intimate stories she tells, the craft she displays, and the emotion it elicits.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: There‚Äôs an important step between ideation and creation for films, comic books, and other mediums that require planning out scenes: making a storyboard. If you‚Äôre working with a script, you already know the flow of your project. The key is to translate that flow and new ideas from word form to image form. In this workshop with Jessy, you‚Äôll learn what is a storyboard and why it is so important in the process of making a music video, commercial or a film.

attributes.title: Personal Documentaries: Your Story, Your Way
attributes.description: Join BAFTA Grant Winner Drama Del Rosario as he talks about putting yourself on camera and exposing your own personal traumas through the art of documentary filmmaking.

copy.heading: About Drama Del Rosario
copy.content:
Drama Del Rosario¬†is a documentary filmmaker based in Los Angeles and originally from Manila, Philippines. He is the winner of the inaugural BAFTA-GSA Commissioning Grant in 2019 for his personal documentary¬†I'm Okay (And Neither Are You)¬†on sexual assault trauma from a gay couple's perspective. He is also the Juried Prize Winner at the PBS Short Film Festival 2020 and the winner of the Loni Ding Award in Social Issue Documentary at CAAMFest 2019 for his personal documentary¬†In This Family, which follows his coming out story as a gay teenager in the Philippines.

As a queer filmmaker, Drama directs documentary films that challenge his conservative upbringing. Through the years, he has received numerous accolades from Outfest Fusion, Doc Edge Festival, the Los Angeles Asian Pacific Film Festival, and many more film festivals around the world. He has also worked with international names including Billy Porter (Emmy Winner,¬†Pose) and BeBe Zahara Benet (Winner,¬†RuPaul's Drag Race, Season 1).

Currently, he is the Senior Video Producer for¬†Believe LTD, an award-winning digital content agency in Los Angeles. His most recent documentary¬†I'm Okay (And Neither Are You)¬†was released in 2020.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content:
Join BAFTA Grant Winner Drama Del Rosario as he talks about putting yourself on camera and exposing your own personal traumas through the art of documentary filmmaking. In this session, you will answer: Is my personal story even worth sharing? How will going public about my own traumas affect my relationships in real life? How can I build a career out of being vulnerable?

For a more enriching experience, you may watch¬†"In This Family", a 12-minute personal documentary about Drama's experience of being outed as gay:¬†https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vCBdpt54c2g

attributes.title: Finding Your Groove as a Digital Artist
attributes.description: If you're like George, it's hard to choose one practice and stick with it. It's also difficult¬†to feel validated and accomplished in this increasingly fast paced digital world of incredible social media talents. In this workshop, George will share his thoughts¬†on what it means to have a successful and fulfilling career as a digital artist.

copy.heading: About George
copy.content:
After quitting his BA in Illustration at the University of Brighton in 2015, George stumbled into the freelance creative world. Initially, taking on whatever jobs came his way, he worked as an illustrator, graphic designer, photographic assistant, editor, club promoter, and West Ham FC/Monster Energy human-merch-mannequin, before finally settling as a motion designer; teaching himself 2D & 3D technical skills entirely through Youtube. Working remotely at first with independent production companies through word-of-mouth, he eventually took the plunge and approached some creative studios, which led him to an internship-come-lead-motion-designer (over the space of almost 3 years) at the Electric Theatre Collective, ETC VFX.

Now leading his own studio, Greedy Goons, George divides his time in between creating commercial motion design and directorial projects within the music industry. Selected clients include: Adidas, Apple Music, Pepsi, Puma, EA, Ray-Ban, Sky, Sony Music & UMG.

Aside from creating and directing, George also works as a mentor, where he not only supports people with their technical skills, but also tries to demystify the visual creative industries to make them more accessible and ultimately, more fun.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content:
Graphic Designer? Illustrator? Photographer? Animator? 3D Modeller? VJ? Game Designer?If you're like George, it's hard to choose one practice and stick with it.

It's also difficult¬†to feel validated and accomplished in this increasingly fast paced digital world of incredible social media talents. In this workshop, George will share his thoughts¬†on what it means to have a successful and fulfilling career as a digital artist. He‚Äôs also share some of his career experiences and pitfalls as he stumbled into his groove as a digital artist.

George will touch on various creative project involvements over the past decade.

copy.heading: About Loes
copy.content: Loes Riphagen, children‚Äôs books writer and illustrator, made her debut in 2008 with her book Night-Time-Bedroom-Creatures. With her cheerful and idiosyncratic illustrations, she always impresses the public, the press and juries. Loes is widely recognised for the beauty and sense of detail and humour in her illustrations. Her latest books have received multiple awards. Her book 'Yes, Coco can!' was awarded¬†Picturebook of the year 2021¬†in the Netherlands and just received a Golden Book award for 75,000 copies sold.¬†For her book ‚ÄòGot Your Nose‚Äô she received a¬†Global Pinwheel Award of Excellence¬†in China and the prestigious¬†Silver European Design Award 2018. This special book was also the winner of¬†The Hong Kong Print Awards 2018¬†and the¬†Global Illustration Honorary Mention Award 2018.Her work has appeared in various countries, including Italy, Turkey, Colombia, Japan, Switserland, France, Spain, Russia, Germany, America, Latvia, Estonia, Finland, Denmark, China, Korea, Taiwan, Portugal and Slovenia.

From ideas to inspiration and concepts, she‚Äôll explain how to come up with characters and compelling images. She‚Äôll also share how inconsistent yet rewarding the creative journey into making a picture book is.

copy.content: Corinne Dodenhoff (she/her) is a graphic designer, illustrator, and all-around creative type living in Philadelphia. Almost completely self-taught, she got her start designing layouts on Myspace, and now works for herself full-time collaborating with bands, brands, business owners, coaches, content creators, publications, and everything in between. She's also a creative consultant, an arts educator, and a fine artist. Outside of work, she's an excellent cat mom, a pretty okay plant mom, an amateur kickboxer, and a musician with her band Queasy.

copy.content: In the design world, visuals are information. So, what better way to learn the ins and outs of visual identity design than to follow along live with a graphic designer as she crafts a brands‚Äô visual identity from scratch? In this design-with-me workshop, Corinne will be walking you through her design workflow, utilizing knowledge from her last two workshops, describing the process as she goes, and answering questions from the audience along the way. Let this workshop refresh your own future workflows, or throw it on half screen and work in tandem with an industry pro.

attributes.title: How To Find Your Art Style
attributes.description: In this session Laura will talk about how to improve your techniques¬†and find a unique¬†art style.

copy.heading: About Laura
copy.content: Laura Longone is a Brazilian artist living in Australia. She works predominantly painting murals and canvas, as well as digital illustration. She has a passion for art and nature, so her style is the combination of both: Botanical Art. The color palette she uses the most are pastel tones because of the contrast between the soft colours and dark markers. Using paint, brush, pen or canvas, she wants to communicate her passion through her pieces. She loves sharing videos on social media of her painting murals to show the calm and satisfying process.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: In this session Laura will talk about how to improve your techniques¬†and find a unique¬†art style. She will explain the¬†importance of¬†improvement as an artist, and some tips about how to experience different designs until you discover your own. Once you focus in your¬†exclusive style, people who appreciate¬†it will come to you and become your clients.

attributes.title: Finding Your Authentic Voice As A Creator
attributes.description: In this workshop, Christina will provide prompts to help you find not only your authentic voice but the confidence to infuse it into all of your creative (and professional) endeavours!

copy.heading: About Christina
copy.content: Christina Wolfgram is a sit-down comedian because she rarely stands up. Her signature comedy videos have been viewed over a billion times on Facebook and Instagram, most notably her Facebook Watch series, Christina Tried Her Best, which racked up over 100 million views in just one season. She has one whole Master‚Äôs in Professional Writing from USC and an on-going prescription for Lexapro, which she takes every morning. She‚Äôs a huge believer that daily creativity makes for a happier brain, so she also teaches writing workshops to help people find their most authentic voice. Most recently, Christina founded Crying is Cool, a store full of funny fashion for stylish sensitives. She also hosts Sobcast the Podcast, where she begs the question, ‚ÄúWhat even is mental health?‚Äù Christina has developed content for countless brands, including Zooey Deschanel‚Äôs HelloGiggles, Hello Kitty, Disney Broadway, Twitch, DragCon, The Calm App, and Lunette Period Cups. She lives in Portland with her perfect cat.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: We're back with MORE writing prompts and advice for finding your authentic voice. All are welcome: those who took the first authentic voice workshop and newcomers alike!¬†Your authentic voice is the foundation for everything you do. Once you find it, you can create literally anything. In this workshop, Christina will provide prompts to help you find not only your authentic voice but the confidence to infuse it into all of your creative (and professional) endeavours!

attributes.title: Pulling Inspiration From Reality
attributes.description: In this workshop, Ciarra will be discussing her curated exhibition, ‚ÄúGrief‚Äù and how to use your reality and the tools in front of you to create authentic, genuine, and honest art.

copy.heading: About Ciarra
copy.content: Ciarra K. Walters (1992) is an interdisciplinary artist based in Prince George's County Maryland, formally based in Los Angeles, California. Her practice centers around self-portraiture, movement-based performance, public art, and art education. Inserting her body in public space, both natural and metropolitan, her performances, videos, and photography examine the relationship between one‚Äôs physical self and its history.¬†Walters' work investigates gender, race, visibility, and violence, invested in exploring wounds and the healing that follows.She has had solo art exhibitions in Los Angeles and New York City. Her clients include The Getty, Cultured Mag, TOAN Mag, Showtime, HBO, Interscope Records, i-D, Adidas, Nike, Urban Outfitters, Well-Read Black Girl, Saint Heron, and many others.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: In a time of uncertainty and what seems to be only bad news, how do artists cope? How do you use your circumstances to make new work? How can art bring back hope?¬†In this workshop, Ciarra will be discussing her curated exhibition, ‚ÄúGrief‚Äù and how to use your reality and the tools in front of you to create authentic, genuine, and honest art.

copy.heading: About Andrea
copy.content: Andrea Orejarena (b. Colombia) is a U.S based multi-media artist. Her work employs the subversive power of play and fantasy to examine the American dream.

copy.heading: About Caleb
copy.content: Caleb Stein (b. 1994, UK, based in the US) is a multimedia artist exploring the relationship between photography, technology, and memory as a way to understand his relationship to the U.S., which is his adopted home.

attributes.title: Why You Should Make Books!
attributes.description: Join Louis as he also shares the process on how to make books from gathering inspiration, designing, pricing, printing, knowing your audience and so much more!

copy.heading: About Louis
copy.content:
Born in Germany, and growing up in France and Italy, Louis moved to the UK from Milan to study Law. His Grandpa gave him his old 35mm Film Camera when he was 16. Years later, his parents then made a bet that if he got a 2:1 in Law, they would buy him a Leica. He now has a 2:1 and a Leica M6.

Louis enjoys documenting key issues that he‚Äôs truly passionate about. He‚Äôs spent the last few years creating series‚Äô that are dedicated to promoting men's mental health and normalising men speaking about their mental health with their friends and family. His ongoing 'Men-Tal Health' series included interviews and familiar faces from Actor Joe Gilgun to Danny Lomas. He's currently shooting a series documenting love and relationships across the UK.

The 25-year-old has been shooting fashion advertorials and editorials for the last two years, shooting on 35mm and medium format film. Louis finds it thoroughly enjoyable to explain how film works and the process behind film photography with clients.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: In the past, making books was considered only accessible to those who were considered well-established. However, times are changing¬†and Louis will share why all creatives should be making books regardless of how long they've been doing their practice. We all have a voice and by using books, we can create a physical copy of our message, identity and what we want to scream to the world. Join Louis as he also shares the process on how to make books from gathering inspiration, designing, pricing, printing, knowing your audience and so much more!

copy.heading: About Hannes
copy.content:
Hannes van Eeden, also known as the Wandering Ambivert is from Cape Town, South Africa.

His photography journey began in late 2013 with a Blackberry. He swapped a Samsung Galaxy S3 for his first DSLR which was an Olympus E-300. A year later, he bought a Nikon D3100 and 5 years after that he bought the camera he‚Äôd been dreaming about since he laid eyes on it, the Nikon D5300.

His photography journey, has taught him one valuable lesson - the best camera is the one with you.

For the past 2 years, he‚Äôs been sharing his creative experiences on his website with the goal to inspire other artists for in creative journeys.

attributes.title: Should I Go Freelance?
attributes.description: In this workshop, George will share his thoughts on when it might be the right time to consider a switch into working as a freelancer. He‚Äôll also share his experience from his¬†transition to being a freelance Director and Motion Designer.

copy.heading: About George
copy.content:
After quitting his BA in Illustration at the University of Brighton in 2015, George stumbled into the freelance creative world. Initially, taking on whatever jobs came his way before finally settling as a motion designer; teaching himself 2D & 3D technical skills entirely through Youtube. Working remotely at first with independent production companies through word-of-mouth, he eventually took the plunge and approached some creative studios, which led him to an internship-come-lead-motion-designer (over the space of almost 3 years) at the Electric Theatre Collective, ETC VFX.

Now leading his own studio, Greedy Goons, George divides his time in between creating commercial motion design and directorial projects within the music industry. Selected clients include: Adidas, Apple Music, Pepsi, Puma, EA, Ray-Ban, Sky, Sony Music & UMG. Aside from creating and directing, George also works as a mentor, where he not only supports people with their technical skills, but also tries to demystify the visual creative industries to make them more accessible and ultimately, more fun.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content:
Will I ever get another job? How will I find clients? Will I be able to pay this month's rent? The¬†switch to being freelance is an anxiety inducing proposition that many creatives will face at some point in the career.

In this workshop, George will share his thoughts on when it might be the right time to consider a switch into working as a freelancer. He‚Äôll also share his experience from his¬†transition to being a freelance Director and Motion Designer. You‚Äôll explore the creative, financial, social, business, geographic and temporal implications of switching to a freelance¬†life. George will also offer some tips for those who are considering the switch, or those who just want a better understanding.

attributes.title: Stepping Into Your Vulnerability As An Artist
attributes.description: In this workshop, Ciarra discusses the power of vulnerability in one‚Äôs art, breaking down her art process and work, along with the work of artists around the world throughout the twentieth and twenty-first century. Learn how vulnerability transcends artists‚Äô work and uplifts the community around you.

copy.heading: About Ciarra
copy.content: Ciarra K. Walters (1992) is an interdisciplinary artist based in Prince George's County Maryland, formally based in Los Angeles, California. Her practice centers around self-portraiture, movement-based performance, public art, and art education. Inserting her body in public space, both natural and metropolitan, her performances, videos, and photography examine the relationship between one‚Äôs physical self and its history. Walters' work investigates gender, race, visibility, and violence, invested in exploring wounds and the healing that follows.She has had solo art exhibitions in Los Angeles and New York City. Her clients include The Getty, Cultured Mag, TOAN Mag, Showtime, HBO, Interscope Records, i-D, Adidas, Nike, Urban Outfitters, Well-Read Black Girl, Saint Heron, and many others.

copy.heading: The Session

attributes.title: Illustrate with Adobe
attributes.description: Join illustrator Ola as he demonstrates how you can take any picture and turn it into a beautiful surreal illustration. This is an introductory workshop where Ola will take you through his process on how to manipulate images with Adobe Illustrator, and Adobe Lightroom.

copy.heading: About Ola
copy.content:
Ola was born in Nigeria and left when he was 12 and moved up to Las Vegas to run away from conflict back home, and as hard as that was it opened many new worlds for him and that propelled Ola to pursue a career in computer science (which he later regretted). Ola then dropped out of the university of Toronto to become a Graphic artist/ Graphic designer. He focuses mainly on portrait photography and digital Illustration. 

He is currently based in Toronto, Ontario and studying graphic design at Sault College. Ola started doing digital illustrations in 2018 out of fascination as he had not been into anything artsy since he was 5. He loved how free flowing digital art can be. He posted some of his work on TikTok and Instagram and the reception was unbelievable, and over the past year Ola has been able to form a community of over 200k people online!

Ola makes digital illustrations based on pictures he‚Äôs taken or that of other creators, with the idea of helping the photo tell its story better, or changing it completely with his imagination. There's always a story in a picture, and Ola‚Äôs job is to better convey that story!

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Join illustrator Ola as he demonstrates how you can take any picture and turn it into a beautiful surreal illustration. This is an introductory workshop where Ola will take you through his process on how to manipulate images with Adobe Illustrator, and Adobe Lightroom.

attributes.title: How To Start A Realistic Painting
attributes.description: Going from a scary blank canvas all the way to a fully realized and realistic first layer of paint you can be proud of as well as the concepts and rules that form our perception of visual reality. Join David in this workshop and learn all the basics in getting started!

copy.heading: About David
copy.content:
b. 1987 David Shepherd is a Hyperrealism Artist who paints in oil on canvas. Born in Canada, David began showing a talented interest in the visual arts from early childhood. During his high school years he was introduced to paintings by Rembrandt and Salvador Dali and was enamoured with the idea of creating his own paintings that would be just as beautiful and meaningful for his career. He was first exhibited at the Art Gallery of Hamilton at the age of 19 (A gallery that includes a multi-million dollar collection of 16th - 21st Century Masters).

Seeking a post-secondary education that could help him achieve his dream, he was fortunate to find the Academy of Realist Art in Toronto.  The school‚Äôs curriculum is based on the 19th Century French Academic system made famous by William Bouguereau. The internationally acclaimed artist John Michael Angel started the school during the 1990‚Äôs Resurrection of Realism and the academy continues to be the only school in Canada that has kept the excellent standards established during the period of high Realism in 20th Century Europe. David graduated with honors from their 4-year program in 2012 and has continued his journey as an independent artist since.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Why gesso? To Tone or not to Tone? Going from a scary blank canvas all the way to a fully realized and realistic first layer of paint you can be proud of as well as the concepts and rules that form our perception of visual reality. Join David in this workshop and learn all the basics in getting started!

Her work has been shown at Vincom Center for Contemporary Art in Hanoi, Blow-Up Film Festival in Chicago, Museum of the Moving Image in NY, OLA Latino Film Festival in NY and Broken Screen Festival in Buenos Aires and published in articles by i-D Vice, It‚Äôs Nice That, Urbanautica, and Palm* Studios, among others.

copy.heading: About Christina
copy.content: Christina Wolfgram is a sit-down comedian because she rarely stands up. Her signature comedy videos have been viewed over a billion times on Facebook and Instagram, most notably her Facebook Watch series, Christina Tried Her Best, which racked up over 100 million views in just one season. She has one whole Master‚Äôs in Professional Writing from USC and an on-going prescription for Lexapro, which she takes every morning. She‚Äôs a huge believer that daily creativity makes for a happier brain, so she also teaches writing workshops to help people find their most authentic voice. Most recently, Christina founded Crying is Cool, a store full of funny fashion for stylish sensitives. She also hosts Sobcast the Podcast, where she begs the question, ‚ÄúWhat even is mental health?‚Äù Christina has developed content for countless brands, including Zooey Deschanel‚Äôs HelloGiggles, Hello Kitty, Disney Broadway, Twitch, DragCon, The Calm App, and Lunette Period Cups. She lives in Portland with her perfect cat.

Join Christina for another interactive workshop where you‚Äôll learn how to keep the perfect notebook for YOU. attributes.title: How Do You Find Inspiration?
attributes.description: By using unique hobbies, experiences and music tastes, we can influence and strengthen our identity as an artist. Join Louis in this discussion!

copy.heading: About Louis
copy.content:
Born in Germany, and growing up in France and Italy, Louis moved to the UK from Milan to study Law. His Grandpa gave him his old 35mm Film Camera when he was 16. Years later, his parents then made a bet that if he got a 2:1 in Law, they would buy him a Leica. He now has a 2:1 and a Leica M6.

Louis enjoys documenting key issues that he‚Äôs truly passionate about. He‚Äôs spent the last few years creating series‚Äô that are dedicated to promoting men's mental health and normalising men speaking about their mental health with their friends and family. His ongoing 'Men-Tal Health' series included interviews and familiar faces from Actor Joe Gilgun to Danny Lomas. He's currently shooting a series documenting love and relationships across the UK.

The 25-year-old has been shooting fashion advertorials and editorials for the last two years, shooting on 35mm and medium format film. Louis finds it thoroughly enjoyable to explain how film works and the process behind film photography with clients.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: We put pressure on ourselves to compare our work to similar creatives in order to find inspiration. Creatives forget to look outside of the box and use diverse experiences that do not relate to their craft. By using unique hobbies, experiences and music tastes, we can influence and strengthen our identity as an artist. Join Louis in this discussion!

copy.heading: About Debbie
copy.content: Session drummer and clinician Debbie Knox-Hewson began her professional career in a whirlwind playing for popstar Charli XCX, who she has toured the world extensively, appearing on various television/festival slots such as: Glastonbury, Lollapalooza, Reading & Leeds, Saturday Night Live, The David Letterman Show, Radio 1 Live Lounge and the Official Olympic Opening Ceremony in London. In addition to her Charli XCX work, Debbie‚Äôs economical style has graced records and tours with bands such as James, Honeyblood, Clean Bandit, Rae Morris, Betsy and CuckooLander. Most recently, Debbie has been in Los Angeles, filming a Netflix Original documentary about the formation of her own band, Nasty Cherry, with whom she is exploring her songwriting and production skills.

copy.heading: About Sonia
copy.content: Sonia Kreitzer is a Los Angeles-based singer, songwriter, and soundhealer. She has released four full-length records under her project, ‚ÄúDoe Paoro,‚Äù and toured alongside artists such as The Gipsy Kings and Sylvan Esso. As a songwriter, she has written songs for many artists, including Peter, Bjorn & Jon and Monogem. Her music has been featured on NPR, BBC, Triple J radio and in films and television. Cumulatively, her music has over 25M streams across platforms. She believes in the power of music as a universal source of healing.

attributes.title: How To Bring Your Poetry To Life
attributes.description: In this workshop, Alieu will explore how to manipulate video and images in order to do exactly that, in hope of keeping readers and viewers intrigued enough to return to your platform.

copy.heading: About Alieu
copy.content:
Ali is a poet based in Denmark, however, was raised in London. He fell in love with poetry around the age of 10, whilst he was studying in secondary school.

He became addicted to writing poetry when he realised the way one poem could have a million different meanings through interpretation. Reading it differently you could have a million different perspectives, views and opinions about how it makes you feel. Since then he has used poetry as a way to express himself, as a medicine to a clogged up mind filled with thoughts and frustrations.

Two years ago, was the first time he performed in front of an audience. As much as it was a nerve-racking experience, his stage presence captivates audiences, leaving them entranced in his words. Since then, Ali has been invited to multiple events to perform his poetry, that often centres around self-expression, political insights and identity.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: With todays different media varieties, there are so many ways to transform your writing in a way that will grasp a reader‚Äôs attention. In this workshop, Alieu will explore how to manipulate video and images in order to do exactly that, in hope of keeping readers and viewers intrigued enough to return to your platform.

attributes.title: Building Worlds in 3D
attributes.description: In this session, George will break down his frog-band concept artwork, sharing his thoughts and process regarding asset creation, texturing, lighting, rendering and compositing.

copy.heading: About George
copy.content:
After quitting his BA in Illustration at the University of Brighton in 2015, George stumbled into the freelance creative world. Initially, taking on whatever jobs came his way before finally settling as a motion designer; teaching himself 2D & 3D technical skills entirely through Youtube. Working remotely at first with independent production companies through word-of-mouth, he eventually took the plunge and approached some creative studios, which led him to an internship-come-lead-motion-designer (over the space of almost 3 years) at the Electric Theatre Collective, ETC VFX.

Now leading his own studio, Greedy Goons, George divides his time in between creating commercial motion design and directorial projects within the music industry. Selected clients include: Adidas, Apple Music, Pepsi, Puma, EA, Ray-Ban, Sky, Sony Music & UMG. Aside from creating and directing, George also works as a mentor, where he not only supports people with their technical skills, but also tries to demystify the visual creative industries to make them more accessible and ultimately, more fun.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content:
Whether you're wanting to create a frosty elven grotto, a sci-fi cityscape or a frog-band performing in a mushroom¬†grave, 3D world building gives you the ability to quickly¬†realise and iterate on your creative vision.

In this session I will break down my frog-band concept artwork, sharing my thoughts and process regarding asset creation, texturing, lighting, rendering and compositing.

I will also share some mesmerising inspiration resources and basic image theory tips for developing¬†creative ideas and successful compositions.

As always, please come with questions!

attributes.title: Build Your Brand: Unmistakable Artist Identity
attributes.description: In this workshop, you will learn tangible skills to help build your brand and unmistakable artist identity.

copy.heading: About Aunia
copy.content:
Aunia Kahn is a multi-faceted creative entrepreneur passionate about creativity, design, marketing, and psychology. She is a globally awarded, collected, and exhibited artist/photographer, published author, instructor, designer, and inspirational speaker. Kahn's art and photography have been exhibited in over 300 exhibitions in over 10 countries. She has curated several internationally recognized exhibitions and book projects.

She has also worked in trauma research, community projects, and mental health since 2005, and created the launching pad for Create for Healing, a community-based resource that utilizes the power of creativity as a tool for healing and improving one‚Äôs wellbeing. Kahn has also curated exhibitions focusing on trauma and mental health and continues her work by teaching courses, offering free resources, and providing tools to those in need. She is also the owner of Rise Visible, with 24-years of experience in the field of branding, web development, and marketing she has worked across various industries helping small businesses and enthusiastic entrepreneurs elevate their businesses to the next level. She works with clients and colleagues to build trustworthy brand identities, successful marketing strategies, and a solid and informative web presence. Her passions for psychology, design and art are found among her living art museum/home cuddling with her two dogs.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: In this workshop, you will learn tangible skills to help build your brand and unmistakable artist identity. Your unique artistic persona coupled with a recognizable creative style is what forms a powerful artist identity, which in turn helps you obtain the desired reputation and publicity for your art. I look forward to partnering with you and guiding your journey in creating an artistic identity that is impactful and stays true to your vision.

copy.heading: About Christina
copy.content: Christina Wolfgram is a sit-down comedian because she rarely stands up. Her signature comedy videos have been viewed over a billion times on Facebook and Instagram, most notably her Facebook Watch series, Christina Tried Her Best, which racked up over 100 million views in just one season. She has one whole Master‚Äôs in Professional Writing from USC and an on-going prescription for Lexapro, which she takes every morning. She‚Äôs a huge believer that daily creativity makes for a happier brain, so she also teaches writing workshops to help people find their most authentic voice. Most recently, Christina founded Crying is Cool, a store full of funny fashion for stylish sensitives. She also hosts Sobcast the Podcast, where she begs the question, ‚ÄúWhat even is mental health?‚Äù Christina has developed content for countless brands, including Zooey Deschanel‚Äôs HelloGiggles, Hello Kitty, Disney Broadway, Twitch, DragCon, The Calm App, and Lunette Period Cups. She lives in Portland with her perfect cat.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Do you feel like you never have the time to get a significant amount of writing done in your daily life? In this workshop, Christina will take you through a series of writing sprints - a tool that trains your brain to get a whole lot of creative work done in super short spurts of time. All writers and artists welcome. Bring a work in progress to work on or use one of the prompts provided!

attributes.title: Digitising Handmade Illustrations
attributes.description: In this class, Jola will show you fundamental skills in transferring your flat-paper images into digital files so that your work can obtain new dimensions and give you the endless potential of turning your art into prints, pattern designs and multiple other uses.

copy.heading: About Jola
copy.content: Jola is a freelance illustrator and calligrapher based in Brighton, UK. She works in watercolour and ink, mostly focusing on food and botanical illustration for custom commissions in branding, food packaging, logo design. She teaches watercolour and pointed pen calligraphy in-person and online. Check out her Instagram for art updates and inspiration at www.instagram.com/JolaPictures.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content:
If you intend to make an income from your handmade illustration art, you need to acquire the necessary skills of digitising your artworks.

In this class, Jola will show you fundamental skills in transferring your flat-paper images into digital files so that your work can obtain new dimensions and give you the endless potential of turning your art into prints, pattern designs and multiple other uses.

The class is suitable for beginners, although it is necessary to have access to a scanner or a good quality camera set up (to take a high resolution photo of your artwork) and editing software Jola will be working with Adobe Photoshop to show you how to clean up and edit a scanned illustration to make it look neat and enticing. She will be using a flatbed scanner by Canon, model LiDE 220 and the scanner software that comes with the device.

attributes.title: Combining Fashion and 3D
attributes.description: During the workshop, Julia will take you through her journey as a digital artist and demonstrate how you can use 3D to expand your creativity and work across multiple disciplines such as fashion, photography or spatial design to create commercial works for brands and magazines.

copy.heading: About Julia
copy.content:
Julia Salnikova is a 3D artist based in Moscow, who without a camera, a team or a photo studio, creates imaginative fashion portraits.
Her creative journey began with studying spatial design and working as a set designer, which then led to her transition to the digital realm, where she would create her environments in 3D to avoid the limitations of the physical world.
Having a multidisciplinary approach to her art and a mix of influences, she now works at the intersection of fashion, beauty and technology and mostly focuses on avatars and digital garments. Through her work she aims to explore different perceptions of beauty and fun narratives to embellish reality and extend it in unexpected ways.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: During the workshop, Julia will take you through her journey as a digital artist and demonstrate how you can use 3D to expand your creativity and work across multiple disciplines such as fashion, photography or spatial design to create commercial works for brands and magazines. At the end of the workshop participants will be able to have a quick Q&A session to ask more questions about Julia‚Äôs process and approach.

copy.heading: About Ciarra
copy.content: Ciarra K. Walters (1992) is an interdisciplinary artist based in Prince George's County Maryland, formally based in Los Angeles, California. Her practice centers around self-portraiture, movement-based performance, public art, and art education. Inserting her body in public space, both natural and metropolitan, her performances, videos, and photography examine the relationship between one‚Äôs physical self and its history. Walters' work investigates gender, race, visibility, and violence, invested in exploring wounds and the healing that follows.She has had solo art exhibitions in Los Angeles and New York City. Her clients include The Getty, Cultured Mag, TOAN Mag, Showtime, HBO, Interscope Records, i-D, Adidas, Nike, Urban Outfitters, Well-Read Black Girl, Saint Heron, and many others.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Pulling from her personal journey in Los Angeles as a creative, Ciarra will share how she built a community in a new city, made genuine connections, and developed a supportive, online community.

copy.heading: About Josh
copy.content:
Josh is the directing half of producer/director duo Saul & Josh. They are represented by Agile Films in the UK and create commercials rooted in the real, with a heavy focus on casting and performance combined with energetic and sometimes unexpected camera movement, with hidden cuts and seamless transitions guiding the viewer through powerful and often emotional narratives.

Their interest in elevating truthful and honest stories has seen them create work for clients such as British Airways, LinkedIn and The NHS as well as charities such as The Children‚Äôs society and Muslim Aid. Josh‚Äôs last short film was commissioned by the BFI and he is currently developing a TV series.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: In this workshop with Josh, you will learn how to lay the foundations for a successful career direction commercials. It will include tips on supporting yourself white getting to know your tastes, sharpening your skills, and finding your voice. It was also teach you how to develop a network of collaborators, build your portfolio and share it. Ultimately, this is a workshop based on things Josh wished someone told him when starting out!

attributes.title: Learn to Draw Immersive Backgrounds
attributes.description: In my illustrations, my characters explore various settings. I'll cover my creative progress and share how I set up backgrounds. I'll give a brief explanation of perspective, but mostly how I use it in my works.

copy.heading: About Pinlin
copy.content:
My passion for art started ever since I could hold a pencil. During childhood, I spent most of the time watching animations on TV. This was the first spark that got me interested in drawing. Netherlands has a rich history in art, but in modern times the community is small. In 2013, I discovered digital art and started sharing my work online under the name ‚ÄúPinlin‚Äù. The online environment was a gold mine of inspiration. Ever since then, I‚Äôve been doing self-studies to polish my skills and knowledge. My main source was from watching other artists draw. I tried their techniques and adjust them to my style.

My favorite subjects are characters in settings and scenery. It‚Äôs wonderful to see my ideas and stories coming to life through my painting. My style has roots in anime but I like to experiment with colors and composition.

In previous years, I had my work featured in the Dutch comic museum and local magazine AniWay. Recently, I began an online art class. I hope to support and inspire fellow artists who like to express their creativity.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: In my illustrations, my characters explore various settings. I'll cover my creative progress and share how I set up backgrounds. I'll give a brief explanation of perspective, but mostly how I use it in my works.

copy.heading: About Gabriella
copy.content: Gabriella S. Csapo is a Photographer and Social Media Manager based in Detroit, MI. She has been shooting for 3 years professionally and helping businesses build their brand on social media over the past year. You can find her on most social media platforms as¬†@GabriellaStephanieC or view her work at¬†GabriellaStephanieC.com

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: The hardest part of working as a freelance artist is seeing people all around you, doing what YOU want to do - so how do you get there? Are you ready to be in their position? In this workshop, we talk about understanding your place in the ever-evolving industry, the mental and emotional maturity it takes to be a freelance artist, and how understanding both will help build a brand (and reputation) for you.
