attributes.title: How to Learn A New Creative Skill
attributes.description: In this session, George will share his experiences and thoughts regarding learning new and alien skills... specifically his¬†goal to¬†learn to sculpt in¬†VR. He will discuss how to manage your time as a self-directed student around a busy schedule, and how to set yourself milestones and deadlines.

copy.heading: About George
copy.content:
After quitting his BA in Illustration at the University of Brighton in 2015, George stumbled into the freelance creative world. Initially, taking on whatever jobs came his way before finally settling as a motion designer; teaching himself 2D & 3D technical skills entirely through Youtube. Working remotely at first with independent production companies through word-of-mouth, he eventually took the plunge and approached some creative studios, which led him to an internship-come-lead-motion-designer (over the space of almost 3 years) at the Electric Theatre Collective, ETC VFX.

Now leading his own studio, Greedy Goons, George divides his time in between creating commercial motion design and directorial projects within the music industry. Selected clients include: Adidas, Apple Music, Pepsi, Puma, EA, Ray-Ban, Sky, Sony Music & UMG. Aside from creating and directing, George also works as a mentor, where he not only supports people with their technical skills, but also tries to demystify the visual creative industries to make them more accessible and ultimately, more fun.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content:
As creators, we often find our groove with our own specific methods and tools.

This is great... but what about trying something new?

Do you find it difficult to move out of your creative comfort zone?

I know I do.

In this session I will share my experiences and thoughts regarding learning new and alien skills... specifically my¬†goal to¬†learn to sculpt in¬†VR.

I will discuss how to manage your time as a self-directed student around a busy schedule, and how to set yourself milestones and deadlines.

Of course, our motivation to learn isn't always there, so I'd like to share some tips on how to stay active and have others keep you accountable.

As always, please come with questions!

attributes.title: How To Build An Instagram Portfolio
attributes.description: Join Louis in this workshop as he takes us through the fundamentals of curating an Instagram portfolio.

copy.heading: About Louis
copy.content:
Born in Germany, and growing up in France and Italy, Louis moved to the UK from Milan to study Law. His Grandpa gave him his old 35mm Film Camera when he was 16. Years later, his parents then made a bet that if he got a 2:1 in Law, they would buy him a Leica. He now has a 2:1 and a Leica M6.

Louis enjoys documenting key issues that he‚Äôs truly passionate about. He‚Äôs spent the last few years creating series‚Äô that are dedicated to promoting men's mental health and normalising men speaking about their mental health with their friends and family. His ongoing 'Men-Tal Health' series included interviews and familiar faces from Actor Joe Gilgun to Danny Lomas. He's currently shooting a series documenting love and relationships across the UK.

The 25-year-old has been shooting fashion advertorials and editorials for the last two years, shooting on 35mm and medium format film. Louis finds it thoroughly enjoyable to explain how film works and the process behind film photography with clients.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Formerly galleries, physical portfolios and art school were our foot in the door to share our work with the world. On the other hand, the internet has allowed us to share our work with a wider audience without having to break our bank accounts. Instagram has become an easily accessible portfolio for visual artists. The main task is to put your identity and creative medium into your Instagram for people to enjoy. Join Louis in the workshop as he guides you on how to create your Instagram portfolio.

attributes.title: Improve Your Acrylic Painting Skills
attributes.description: In this workshop, Rachel will walk you through simple exercises to help you get familiar with breaking down a reference, mixing up color, and applying differing shades to create depth and realism in your paintings.

copy.heading: About Rachel
copy.content: Rachel Christopoulos is an acrylic artist in Madison, WI. Her work is created from a place of pure curiosity and a passion for color, individuality, and word play. She often describes herself as an old soul, coffee connoisseur, and a dreamer (though she's not the only one). Though she paints a variety of subjects, her artwork focuses on blending the familiar with new ideas and bright colors to create an individualistic play on everyday scenes.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Learn how to find, mix, and paint color with acrylic paint. In this workshop, Rachel will walk you through simple exercises to help you get familiar with breaking down a reference, mixing up color, and applying differing shades to create depth and realism in your paintings. By the end of this class, you will be able to accurately translate color from your head to your canvas.

copy.heading: Supplies
copy.content:
There will be live demonstration in the workshop. Here are the supplies required if you wish to follow along:

‚Ä¢ Acrylic paint - white, cadmium yellow, quinacridone magenta, cadmium red, ultramarine blue, Payne's grey.
‚Ä¢ Brushes (any kind but flat 1/2" work best)
‚Ä¢ Painting surface like mixed media paper or canvas
‚Ä¢ Jar of water
‚Ä¢ Rag or paper towel

attributes.title: How To Promote Yourself As An Artist
attributes.description: This workshop is an overview of the different marketing methods for a visual artist.

copy.heading: About Amelia
copy.content: Amelia Hadouchi was born in Montreal and was exposed to the arts at a very young age. Amelia began taking painting workshops at the age of 9 to pursue her passion for the arts and hasn't stopped since. She was discovered by a gallery in Miami after posting her creations on social media, and was invited to exhibit her work during Art Basel in 2015, her debut exhibition. Surrounded by accomplished artists, she was inspired to continue working on her career as a professional painter.¬†Many public figures have acquired Amelia's works as a result of her exhibition at Art Basel 2015 and her significant social media presence. Her social media networks have also led to collaborations with brands including Volvo, Daniel Wellington, Marc Jacobs, New Balance and more.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: This workshop with Amelia is an overview of the different marketing methods for a visual artist. How to promote yourself and your work, the networking aspect of marketing and dealing with fear and anxiety when putting yourself out there as a creative.

attributes.title: Exploring Multiple Creative Paths
attributes.description: In this workshop, we embrace the concept that creatives do not need to pursue a singular path to achieve success and great fulfilment

copy.heading: About Aunia
copy.content:
Aunia Kahn is a multi-faceted creative entrepreneur passionate about creativity, design, marketing, and psychology. She is a globally awarded, collected, and exhibited artist/photographer, published author, instructor, designer, and inspirational speaker. Kahn's art and photography have been exhibited in over 300 exhibitions in over 10 countries. She has curated several internationally recognized exhibitions and book projects.

She has also worked in trauma research, community projects, and mental health since 2005, and created the launching pad for Create for Healing, a community-based resource that utilizes the power of creativity as a tool for healing and improving one‚Äôs wellbeing. Kahn has also curated exhibitions focusing on trauma and mental health and continues her work by teaching courses, offering free resources, and providing tools to those in need. She is also the owner of Rise Visible, with 24-years of experience in the field of branding, web development, and marketing she has worked across various industries helping small businesses and enthusiastic entrepreneurs elevate their businesses to the next level. She works with clients and colleagues to build trustworthy brand identities, successful marketing strategies, and a solid and informative web presence. Her passions for psychology, design and art are found among her living art museum/home cuddling with her two dogs.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: In this workshop, we embrace the concept that creatives do not need to pursue a singular path to achieve success and great fulfilment. Creative people tend to have a wide variety of interests, which is the foundation of creativity. A creative life is enhanced with exploration, experimentation, and wonder - so why limit yourself! Don't be torn between different creative ambitions - embrace them all and invite them into the playing field. You never know what kind of team you will create!

attributes.title: Get Started With Squeegee Art
attributes.description: In this workshop with Clara, you‚Äôll learn all things squeegee art! From what exactly is squeegee art, to what materials you need to get started, and the basic techniques, Clara will show you how to create unique paintings.

copy.heading: About Clara
copy.content: Clara has engaged in creative activities since she was a child. Her father used to paint landscapes on canvas, while her grandma and aunt undertook all sorts of DIY projects. Clara tagged along, and her interest only grew.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: In this workshop with Clara, you‚Äôll learn all things squeegee art! From what exactly is squeegee art, to what materials you need to get started, and the basic techniques, Clara will show you how to create unique paintings. You‚Äôll also follow along with Clara and create one or two paintings and then as a group discuss the techniques and results.

copy.heading: Follow Along with Clara!
copy.content:
If you would like to follow along with Clara as she paints step by step, these are the supplies recommended to have on hand:

-Acrylic paint. Make sure to pick the opaque ones. Brand suggestions: Liquitex, Amsterdam, Boesner, Golden and Winsor & Newton.
-Squeegee / scraper. Make sure they are soft and smooth enough not to mark or damage the paper. It‚Äôs recommended to use the ones made of silicon, rubber or soft plastic. Brand suggestion: Catalyst Wedge W-06 from Princeton Brushes.
-Painter‚Äôs tape. Brand suggestion: Tesa professional painter‚Äôs tape ‚Äì inside.
-Watercolor or acrylic paper, minimum 300g. Brand suggestion: Fabriano cold pressed 300g watercolour paper.
-Paper towel or rag
-Palette knife/knives (optional)
-Acrylic marker in white or black (optional). Brand suggestion: Posca.

attributes.title: Learn How To Draw In Procreate
attributes.description: In this workshop with Vicky, she will create a drawing while explaining each step and tool as you go along.

copy.heading: About Vicky
copy.content:
Vicky Catal√°n is a designer and digital artist interested in experimenting with technology and digital tools, focusing her work on the creation process.

"Work smarter not harder" is the quote that has inspired her series of digital drawings: "Draw smarter, not harder" that seeks to provoke the audience's reaction through the contrast between the classic drawing methods and the new digital techniques.

She holds two degrees, one in Fine Arts from University of Barcelona (UB) and a Master Degree in Visual Arts Education from the Universidad Nebrija in Madrid.

She manages a Creative Agency who works for companies all over the world on projects at major international exhibitions. She has designed for brands as Imaginarium, Dodot, Nikon, Antonio Puig among others.

Her drawings have reached more 8.4 million likes and 245K followers on TikTok.¬†[https://www.tiktok.com/@vickycatalan_]

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content:
Do you know how to get the most out of digital tools in¬†Procreate?

One of the best things about drawing in Procreate and using layers is that you can draw in a non-destructive workflow. That means that as you move forward you don't need to get rid of the work you've already done. Keeping all the steps and elements of your work separate, you can use the tools independently, without affecting the rest of the elements of your work. You just have to keep your document organised, know the tools, and use them creatively to achieve amazing results.

In this workshop with Vicky, you'll put all this into practice; making a drawing and explaining each step and tool as you go along.

*It is recommended to download Procreate to follow along in this workshop with Vicky*

copy.heading: About Omar
copy.content:
Omar Momani is a Jordanian cartoonist and animator. Best known for his sport editorial cartoons for Goal and the Bundesliga.

Momani started his animation career at Abu Mahjoob studio in Jordan in 2005. Along with the team, Momani worked on an animated show for the Jordanian TV and it was nominated for best foreign animated series award in Annecy Animation Festival in 2006. Later on, Momani was the animation team leader for the Emirati animated show Shaabia Al Cartoon ÿ¥ÿπÿ®Ÿäÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÉÿ±ÿ™ŸàŸÜ, from 2007 to 2010.

At 2010, Momani decided to draw editorial sport cartoons, which it attracted the football news website Goal, where Momani started to publish his cartoons since then. This led to collaborate with other sport platforms, such as the Bundesliga, Sporting News, the Arabian Gulf League, Fox Sports, International Champions Cup, South America Foundation, Al Arabi Al Jadeed newspaper and others.

Momani was nominated three times by the Football Blogging Awards for the Best International Football Blog in 2016, 2018 and 2019. He was also chosen as the 5th of the top animators to follow on Twitter by Pixel77 and Creative Bloq.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Join cartoonist and animator Omar in this workshop as he explains the basics of Adobe Animate. He‚Äôll explore the application with participants and work on a live demonstration animating characters. This workshop is open to all levels.

attributes.title: Intro to Acting: The Basics
attributes.description: Join Ian Nelson in this introductory acting workshop to learn the basics of acting. Together, you‚Äôll explore the importance of storytelling and communication. Ian will also share resources and have participants collaborate on exercises.

copy.heading: About Ian
copy.content:
Raised in Winston-Salem, North Carolina, Ian Nelson began his career at an early age as an actor, singer, and dancer. His screen debut came in a featured role in the blockbuster Lionsgate film THE HUNGER GAMES. Since then, Nelson has steadily worked in both TV/film, in projects like THE BOY NEXT DOOR (Blumhouse/Universal), THE JUDGE (Warner Bros.), THE BEST OF ME (Relativity), Teen Wolf (MTV), and THERE‚ÄôS JOHNNY (Peacock), having shared the screen with actors such as Robert Duvall, Bette Midler, Robert Downey, Jr., Jennifer Lopez, Michelle Monaghan, Laverne Cox, and many more.

Most recently, Nelson was seen in the films LIKE ME opposite Addison Timlin, which premiered at SXSW, and Trudie Styler's FREAK SHOW (IFC Films) that debuted at the Berlin Film Festival. In addition he was seen in the Hulu pilot LESS THAN ZERO, CAMP opposite Joey King, and on NETFLIX in SUMMER NIGHT opposite Victoria Justice and Lana Condor, as well as the coming-of-age indie PAPER SPIDERS.

In addition to his acting, writing, and producing, Nelson is also a singer/songwriter and is currently playing live shows with his band around LA, while recording his debut album.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Join Ian Nelson in this introductory acting workshop to learn the basics of acting. Having a baseline understanding of how an actor most adeptly tells a story makes you better, regardless of what creative field you're in. It creates more empathy¬†if you are a director or DP and gives you more tools if you are a dancer, singer or songwriter. We can all benefit from going outside our comfort zone, examining human nature and why we do what we do. Together, you‚Äôll explore the importance of storytelling and communication. Ian will also share resources and have participants collaborate on exercises. Join this workshop with Ian!

attributes.title: Think Less, Write More!
attributes.description: Tick tock, what can your imagination unlock when your mind is focused on the clock? A world filled with fairies and dragons, or real life problems expressing the things that have happened? I‚Äôm intrigued to see what words you combine together for us to read.

copy.heading: About Alieu
copy.content:
Ali is a poet based in Denmark, however, was raised in London. He fell in love with poetry around the age of 10, whilst he was studying in secondary school.

He became addicted to writing poetry when he realised the way one poem could have a million different meanings through interpretation. Reading it differently you could have a million different perspectives, views and opinions about how it makes you feel. Since then he has used poetry as a way to express himself, as a medicine to a clogged up mind filled with thoughts and frustrations.

Two years ago, was the first time he performed in front of an audience. As much as it was a nerve-racking experience, his stage presence captivates audiences, leaving them entranced in his words. Since then, Ali has been invited to multiple events to perform his poetry, that often centres around self-expression, political insights and identity.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Tick tock, what can your imagination unlock when your mind is focused on the clock? A world filled with fairies and dragons, or real life problems expressing the things that have happened? I‚Äôm intrigued to see what words you combine together for us to read.

attributes.title: Creating Visual Stories Using Your Surroundings
attributes.description: This workshop with Debangshu will aim to help you derive inspiration from your surroundings and tell engaging stories.

copy.heading: About Debangshu
copy.content: Debangshu Moulik, an artist based in Pune, India is the kind of artist who is never seen without his sketchbook. Debangshu earned a BFA from Abhinav Kala Vidyalaya, Pune University where he studied Painting. His artworks are stylized and vivid with bold lines and creative uses of colour and form, explored in a variety of mediums. His work features many human characters, who are all rendered with singular expressiveness. He tends to use a lot of colour in his work, in a way that is reminiscent of the fluidity and spontaneity of comic¬†books. There are also traces of traditional influence in his art, especially in the bold lines he uses and the way he draws facial features, which are inspired by the religious iconography in India such as the Kalighat paintings and sculptures of Mahabalipuram. His work draws from comic books, animation and art history.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: This workshop with Debangshu will aim to help you derive inspiration from your surroundings and tell engaging stories. The images created during the workshop will use a mixture of traditional and digital mediums.

attributes.title: Why your Weaknesses are your Greatest Strengths
attributes.description: Join this workshop about reframing how we look at our potential. With author and illustrator Natalie Byrne, you‚Äôll discuss why what we are told by society are our weaknesses, could actually be our greatest strength.

copy.heading: About Natalie
copy.content:
Natalie Byrne is a Latina illustrator based in London. She studied Graphic Design at Sheffield Hallam University, and found her illustrative voice combining colour and important topics. Natalie‚Äôs work promotes intersectional feminism and tackles social issues such as sexual assault, mental health and equality.

Natalie has been featured on BBC woman‚Äôs hour, The Huffington, Refinery 29, The Good Trade and has worked with The BBC, NYX make-up, Lucy & Yak and The Body Shop.

Natalie also co-hosts a podcast about loneliness and mental health, you can listen on apple podcasts or here: (https://www.venuslibido.com/tlc-podcast)

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Join this workshop about reframing how we look at our potential. With author and illustrator Natalie Byrne, you‚Äôll discuss why what we are told by society are our weaknesses, could actually be our greatest strength.

copy.heading: A Note from Natalie
copy.content:
"It‚Äôs Funny how I‚Äôm an author, yet I was told my dyslexia meant I couldn‚Äôt write. When I got my anxiety disorder diagnosis I thought maybe this means I‚Äôm not strong enough to live out my creative dreams.

I‚Äôve been a full time illustrator since 2018, I‚Äôve worked with Nike, cannon, the body shop and Adobe just to name a few. & I‚Äôve learnt that my dyslexia and my anxiety has made me great at running a business."

attributes.title: Transform Yourself into a 3D Character
attributes.description: In her second workshop, Julia will give an intro to avatar creation and take you through her process of making a digital portrait in Daz3D. During her demonstration she will also share her best tips and tricks on how to make a realistic 3D version of yourself.

copy.heading: About Julia
copy.content:
Julia Salnikova is a 3D artist based in Moscow, who without a camera, a team or a photo studio, creates imaginative fashion portraits.

Her creative journey began with studying spatial design and working as a set designer, which then led to her transition to the digital realm, where she would create her environments in 3D to avoid the limitations of the physical world.

Having a multidisciplinary approach to her art and a mix of influences, she now works at the intersection of fashion, beauty and technology and mostly focuses on avatars and digital garments. Through her work she aims to explore different perceptions of beauty and fun narratives to embellish reality and extend it in unexpected ways.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: In her second workshop, Julia will give an intro to avatar creation and take you through her process of making a digital portrait in Daz3D. During her demonstration she will also share her best tips and tricks on how to make a realistic 3D version of yourself.

copy.heading: About Caleb
copy.content: Caleb Stein (b. UK) is a U.S. based multimedia artist whose work explores the fragility of memory and the dynamic, energetic interactions that take place within community. In this workshop, Caleb will share how he makes a living from making his art. Caleb will share his experiences as an emerging artist who has worked with commercial brands, galleries, and publications. The workshop will also look at some key examples of emerging artists who have navigated the commercial, editorial, and art worlds to make a living. Questions and comments encouraged throughout.

attributes.title: WTF is a Personal Brand?
attributes.description: Join Jasmine in this workshop where she shares strategies on how to create a killer personal brand that will exponentially help to build and evolve your Freelance, business, and self-employed or employed future. Ready to translate YOU into YOU?

copy.heading: About Jasmine
copy.content: Jasmine Graduated from Ravensbourne in 2015 with a First-Class BA in Fashion Promotion and a CV showcasing brands; Cosmopolitan Magazine, Harpers Bazaar, and Marie Claire Runway. Dreaming up FYI (Find Your Intern) as her Final Major Project, Jasmine set out to bring the project to life after critical acclaim from Vogue Magazine and winning the Graduate Fashion Week New Media Award in 2015. Working simultaneously in industry as a Graphic Designer for fashion brands, Jasmine launched FYI in 2019 and went full-time with FYI in 2020 after moving out of the city to Bath, Somerset.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content:
Today is all about you. Planet you, baby¬†ü™ê

Personal Branding isn‚Äôt a just pretty logo or a complementary colour pallet. It‚Äôs influenced and informed by what you wear, what you eat, what you read, the perfume you wear, the people in your life. So how TF do you translate this info into a personal brand?! Join Jasmine in this workshop where she shares strategies on how to create a killer personal brand that will exponentially help to build and evolve your Freelance, business, and self-employed or employed future. Ready to translate YOU into YOU?

copy.heading: About Kit
copy.content: Kit Buss is a UK-based comicker and character designer best known for her work on the Vox Machina arc of hit D&D streaming show ‚ÄòCritical Role‚Äô. She has also produced work for Dark Horse, PlayStation, Channel 4, SelfMadeHero, Rebellion Publishing and numerous indie publications and projects. Her ongoing indie comic ‚ÄòCloven: Bloodlines‚Äô launched back in 2018 and is due to launch its first collected edition later this year.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Explore the basics of visual language in character design! From the importance of silhouettes, to finding inspiration in anthropology and sociology, to subverting audience expectations, learn the key steps of designing a character from a 'show, don't tell' approach. Discover how to make strong first impressions and convey backstories and personalities to an audience with a single look.

attributes.title: Intro to Acting: Character Breakdown
attributes.description: In this workshop with Ian Nelson, you‚Äôll learn how to ask the right questions as an actor and break down a character and their behaviour to better perform your scene. This workshop will give you the opportunity to better your skills as an actor.

copy.heading: About Ian
copy.content:
Raised in Winston-Salem, North Carolina, Ian Nelson began his career at an early age as an actor, singer, and dancer. His screen debut came in a featured role in the blockbuster Lionsgate film THE HUNGER GAMES. Since then, Nelson has steadily worked in both TV/film, in projects like THE BOY NEXT DOOR (Blumhouse/Universal), THE JUDGE (Warner Bros.), THE BEST OF ME (Relativity), Teen Wolf (MTV), and THERE‚ÄôS JOHNNY (Peacock), having shared the screen with actors such as Robert Duvall, Bette Midler, Robert Downey, Jr., Jennifer Lopez, Michelle Monaghan, Laverne Cox, and many more.

Most recently, Nelson was seen in the films LIKE ME opposite Addison Timlin, which premiered at SXSW, and Trudie Styler's FREAK SHOW (IFC Films) that debuted at the Berlin Film Festival. In addition he was seen in the Hulu pilot LESS THAN ZERO, CAMP opposite Joey King, and on NETFLIX in SUMMER NIGHT opposite Victoria Justice and Lana Condor, as well as the coming-of-age indie PAPER SPIDERS.

In addition to his acting, writing, and producing, Nelson is also a singer/songwriter and is currently playing live shows with his band around LA, while recording his debut album.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Ever watch a scene and wonder how the actor portrays the character so well? If given the opportunity, do you think you‚Äôd be able to perform and embody the true essence of a character? In this workshop with Ian Nelson, you‚Äôll learn how to ask the right questions as an actor and break down a character and their behaviour to better perform your scene. This workshop will give you the opportunity to better your skills as an actor. You‚Äôll be working with other participants and sharing feedback.

attributes.title: Learn the Basics of Paper Quilling
attributes.description: Discover the art of paper quilling with a live demonstration of a small project. Paper quilling is an ancient art that involves rolling and shaping long strips over paper and gluing them on-edge to create a unique 3D design.

copy.heading: About Carolyn
copy.content: Carolyn Edge is a multi-disciplinary artist currently specializing in paper quilling. Originally from Texas, she now lives in a camper and travels the US full-time. She runs her paper quilling business from the camper, selling original art and teaching others how to quill. A lot of her work explores different styles, techniques and materials that push boundaries on the medium and explore what‚Äôs possible with paper. Follow her work on Instagram and TikTok @TheQuillingEdge.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Discover the art of paper quilling with a live demonstration of a small project. Paper quilling is an ancient art that involves rolling and shaping long strips over paper and gluing them on-edge to create a unique 3D design. The results are stunning, though the basics are easy to learn. Follow along to create your own, though the workshop may move quickly. The replay will be available to finish your project.

copy.heading: Follow Along with Carolyn!
copy.content:
These are the supplies recommended to have on hand if you would like to follow along with Carolyn: 
- A slotted quilling tool (or a toothpick if you don't have quilling supplies)
- Quilling strips (or you can cut paper into 1/4 inch strips if you don't have quilling supplies. Astrobrights paper¬†is great to use for this.)
- Glue
- Scissors
- A ruler
- Craft tweezers
- Cardstock or a blank card
- Something you can spread glue on (a clean plastic lid, scrap cardstock, etc.)

attributes.title: Preventing Burnout with Boundaries
attributes.description: In this interactive¬†workshop, we'll take stock of what's draining out creative batteries in everyday life so that we can create long-lasting boundaries that improve our mental health.

copy.heading: About Christina
copy.content: Christina Wolfgram is a sit-down comedian because she rarely stands up. Her signature comedy videos have been viewed over a billion times on Facebook and Instagram, most notably her Facebook Watch series, Christina Tried Her Best, which racked up over 100 million views in just one season. She has one whole Master‚Äôs in Professional Writing from USC and an on-going prescription for Lexapro, which she takes every morning. She‚Äôs a huge believer that daily creativity makes for a happier brain, so she also teaches writing workshops to help people find their most authentic voice. Most recently, Christina founded Crying is Cool, a store full of funny fashion for stylish sensitives. She also hosts Sobcast the Podcast, where she begs the question, ‚ÄúWhat even is mental health?‚Äù Christina has developed content for countless brands, including Zooey Deschanel‚Äôs HelloGiggles, Hello Kitty, Disney Broadway, Twitch, DragCon, The Calm App, and Lunette Period Cups. She lives in Portland with her perfect cat.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: In this interactive¬†workshop, we'll take stock of what's draining out creative batteries in everyday life so that we can create long-lasting boundaries that improve our mental health. This workshop will also teach tips and tricks for vocalizing boundaries, addressing people who cross boundaries, and how to develop even better boundaries over time.

attributes.title: Intro to Acting: Scene Study
attributes.description: Join Ian Nelson in this workshop as he shares how to do a scene study. Together you'll watch scenes then discuss and analyse what is working about the scene and more importantly,¬†why¬†the¬†acting is good.

copy.heading: About Ian
copy.content:
Raised in Winston-Salem, North Carolina, Ian Nelson began his career at an early age as an actor, singer, and dancer. His screen debut came in a featured role in the blockbuster Lionsgate film THE HUNGER GAMES. Since then, Nelson has steadily worked in both TV/film, in projects like THE BOY NEXT DOOR (Blumhouse/Universal), THE JUDGE (Warner Bros.), THE BEST OF ME (Relativity), Teen Wolf (MTV), and THERE‚ÄôS JOHNNY (Peacock), having shared the screen with actors such as Robert Duvall, Bette Midler, Robert Downey, Jr., Jennifer Lopez, Michelle Monaghan, Laverne Cox, and many more.

Most recently, Nelson was seen in the films LIKE ME opposite Addison Timlin, which premiered at SXSW, and Trudie Styler's FREAK SHOW (IFC Films) that debuted at the Berlin Film Festival. In addition he was seen in the Hulu pilot LESS THAN ZERO, CAMP opposite Joey King, and on NETFLIX in SUMMER NIGHT opposite Victoria Justice and Lana Condor, as well as the coming-of-age indie PAPER SPIDERS.

In addition to his acting, writing, and producing, Nelson is also a singer/songwriter and is currently playing live shows with his band around LA, while recording his debut album.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Join Ian Nelson in this workshop as he shares how to do a scene study. Together you'll watch scenes then discuss and analyse what is working about the scene and more importantly,¬†why¬†the¬†acting is good. By the end of this workshop, you'll have a better understanding of how to properly prep and analyze a scene and how to bring a script to life.

attributes.title: Get Your Freelance Sh!t Together
attributes.description: In this workshop with Carla, you‚Äôll talk about ways to help you find balance and create a healthy routine that supports your freelance work.

copy.heading: About Carla
copy.content:
Carla was born in Buenos Aires and lives in Berlin with her boyfriend and two kittens.
She majored in Advertising and specialized in Content Creation, working for small, medium, and big companies like Penguin Random House, AstraZeneca, and H&M. In 2020 she was granted the Adobe Creative Residency Community Fund.
She slowly distanced herself from the advertising scene to accompany others on their path of creative self-discovery, which she accomplishes through her membership community, creative newsletter and workshops.
Carla is a firm believer in the power of creative introspection, and she is convinced that great things can be achieved when you combine well-done structures with honest sensitivity.
She also believes in the power of Passion Projects, which is why you'll always find her working on one (and encouraging others to create their own).

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: In this workshop with Carla, you‚Äôll talk about ways to help you find balance and create a healthy routine that supports your freelance work. By doing so, you can reduce stress, eliminate feelings of guilt and procrastination and focus on today, improving our productivity. Designing a system that helps us be more focused in our daily lives is, both on the short and the long run, the best course of action for your career and your mental health.

attributes.title: Navigating Creativity as an Artist
attributes.description: Join this workshop with David where he‚Äôll share tips on finding different ways to embrace change as well as how to stay open and channel your creativity as an artist.

copy.heading: About David
copy.content:
b. 1987 David Shepherd is a Hyperrealism Artist who paints in oil on canvas. Born in Canada, David began showing a talented interest in the visual arts from early childhood. During his high school years he was introduced to paintings by Rembrandt and Salvador Dali and was enamoured with the idea of creating his own paintings that would be just as beautiful and meaningful for his career. He was first exhibited at the Art Gallery of Hamilton at the age of 19 (A gallery that includes a multi-million dollar collection of 16th - 21st Century Masters).

Seeking a post-secondary education that could help him achieve his dream, he was fortunate to find the Academy of Realist Art in Toronto. The school‚Äôs curriculum is based on the 19th Century French Academic system made famous by William Bouguereau. The internationally acclaimed artist John Michael Angel started the school during the 1990‚Äôs Resurrection of Realism and the academy continues to be the only school in Canada that has kept the excellent standards established during the period of high Realism in 20th Century Europe. David graduated with honors from their 4-year program in 2012 and has continued his journey as an independent artist since.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Navigating creativity as an artist can be difficult especially when you struggle for inspiration. There can be a thin line between being inspired and imitating someone else‚Äôs work. Join this workshop with David where he‚Äôll share tips on finding different ways to embrace change as well as how to stay open and channel your creativity as an artist.

copy.heading: About Caleb
copy.content: Caleb Stein (b. UK) is a U.S. based multimedia artist whose work explores the fragility of memory and the dynamic, energetic interactions that take place within community. With an industry-spanning and impressive career, his extensive accolades include: exhibitions in the Palm* Photo Prize at Photo London and Photo Vogue Festival at Base Milano; publications in i-D Vice, Dazed and Vogue Italia; and is also working on a book for 'Long Time No See' (2018-2020) in collaboration with video artist Andrea Orejarena and book designer Brian Paul Lamotte.

attributes.title: Intro to Acting: Tips & Tricks
attributes.description: When building a career as an actor, there are a lot of moving parts. Join Ian Nelson as he shares key tips and tricks on how to navigate a career as an actor.

copy.heading: About Ian
copy.content:
Raised in Winston-Salem, North Carolina, Ian Nelson began his career at an early age as an actor, singer, and dancer. His screen debut came in a featured role in the blockbuster Lionsgate film THE HUNGER GAMES. Since then, Nelson has steadily worked in both TV/film, in projects like THE BOY NEXT DOOR (Blumhouse/Universal), THE JUDGE (Warner Bros.), THE BEST OF ME (Relativity), Teen Wolf (MTV), and THERE‚ÄôS JOHNNY (Peacock), having shared the screen with actors such as Robert Duvall, Bette Midler, Robert Downey, Jr., Jennifer Lopez, Michelle Monaghan, Laverne Cox, and many more.

Most recently, Nelson was seen in the films LIKE ME opposite Addison Timlin, which premiered at SXSW, and Trudie Styler's FREAK SHOW (IFC Films) that debuted at the Berlin Film Festival. In addition he was seen in the Hulu pilot LESS THAN ZERO, CAMP opposite Joey King, and on NETFLIX in SUMMER NIGHT opposite Victoria Justice and Lana Condor, as well as the coming-of-age indie PAPER SPIDERS.

In addition to his acting, writing, and producing, Nelson is also a singer/songwriter and is currently playing live shows with his band around LA, while recording his debut album.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: When building a career as an actor, there are a lot of moving parts. From self-tapes, to finding a good agent/manager to building your network, studying your craft, finding inspiration, focusing on your mental and¬†physical health and so much more! Join Ian Nelson as he shares key tips and tricks on how to navigate a career as an actor.

attributes.title: How Do I Become a Fashion Photographer?
attributes.description: What does being a fashion photographer mean?¬†Join¬†Louis as he teaches you what it is like to be shooting fashion projects. Louis will teach you every aspect of what it takes to be behind the camera shooting fashion.

copy.heading: About Louis
copy.content:
Born in Germany, and growing up in France and Italy, Louis moved to the UK from Milan to study Law. His Grandpa gave him his old 35mm Film Camera when he was 16. Years later, his parents then made a bet that if he got a 2:1 in Law, they would buy him a Leica. He now has a 2:1 and a Leica M6.

Louis enjoys documenting key issues that he‚Äôs truly passionate about. He‚Äôs spent the last few years creating series‚Äô that are dedicated to promoting men's mental health and normalising men speaking about their mental health with their friends and family. His ongoing 'Men-Tal Health' series included interviews and familiar faces from Actor Joe Gilgun to Danny Lomas. He's currently shooting a series documenting love and relationships across the UK.

The 25-year-old has been shooting fashion advertorials and editorials for the last two years, shooting on 35mm and medium format film. Louis finds it thoroughly enjoyable to explain how film works and the process behind film photography with clients.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: What does being a fashion photographer mean?¬†Join¬†Louis as he teaches you what it is like to be shooting fashion projects. Louis will teach you every aspect of what it takes to be behind the camera shooting fashion. From fees to portfolios to contacting clients, Louis will cover every nook and cranny.

attributes.title: The Reality and Possibilities of NFTs
attributes.description: Join David as he explores what type of markets we can expect to see in the future, where Meta is now and more importantly how realistic are the expectations from consumers and from producers in this marketplace of the future.

copy.heading: About David
copy.content:
b. 1987 David Shepherd is a Hyperrealism Artist who paints in oil on canvas. Born in Canada, David began showing a talented interest in the visual arts from early childhood. During his high school years he was introduced to paintings by Rembrandt and Salvador Dali and was enamoured with the idea of creating his own paintings that would be just as beautiful and meaningful for his career. He was first exhibited at the Art Gallery of Hamilton at the age of 19 (A gallery that includes a multi-million dollar collection of 16th - 21st Century Masters).

Seeking a post-secondary education that could help him achieve his dream, he was fortunate to find the Academy of Realist Art in Toronto. The school‚Äôs curriculum is based on the 19th Century French Academic system made famous by William Bouguereau. The internationally acclaimed artist John Michael Angel started the school during the 1990‚Äôs Resurrection of Realism and the academy continues to be the only school in Canada that has kept the excellent standards established during the period of high Realism in 20th Century Europe. David graduated with honors from their 4-year program in 2012 and has continued his journey as an independent artist since.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: NFT's have provided the key to a brand new world of possibilities. Just how should we look at the economics of this new world in comparison with the old world? Join David as he explores what type of markets we can expect to see in the future, where Meta is now and more importantly how realistic are the expectations from consumers and from producers in this marketplace of the future.

attributes.title: In House to Freelance Graphic Designer
attributes.description: In this workshop, Julie will talk about how she started her career as an in house graphic designer and how she transitioned step by step to a freelance graphic designer. She will cover the work tasks, the biggest differences, the challenges, and insights into to the everyday life.

copy.heading: About Julie
copy.content: Julie Wieland is a multidisciplinary graphic designer from Luxembourg, currently living and working in Germany, and based on the internet. The internet in the early days led her to learn HTML to customize her Myspace page, and Deviantart inspired her to learn Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator. A few years later, she graduated with a Bachelor of Arts in Communication Design from the Berliner Technische Kunsthochschule. Julie made the jump from being a senior in house graphic designer in Berlin Startups to now being a full time freelance graphic designer. She defines visual narratives for passion driven individuals and do-good-businesses from around the globe and started creating content on social media for fellow designers (and those who aspire to be) filled with top industry resources.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: In this workshop, Julie will talk about how she started her career as an in house graphic designer in Berlin Startups and how she transitioned step by step to a freelance graphic designer (and creator). She will cover the work tasks, the biggest differences, the challenges, and insights into to the everyday life.

copy.content: Jarrett Lampley is a multidisciplinary Graphic Designer, Photographer and Art Director from Chicago, currently based in Los Angeles. He is a graduate of the Design | Media Arts program at UCLA, where he commenced his career in the intersection of visual arts and entertainment by interning at places such as Universal Music Group, Warner Music Group, the DoLaB, Cartoon Network and HITCO. He is also passionate about arts education with an emphasis on the Black community, which he developed as a student educator at the HAMMER museum and a committee member of the Afrikan Arts Ensemble at UCLA. After graduating, he expanded the scope of his creative practice to television, film and sports, where he‚Äôs worked on production projects for clients including Hulu, the NFL, and NBC.

attributes.title: Basics of Figma for Absolute Beginners
attributes.description: Figma is a free design tool that is used to make apps and websites by some of the biggest tech companies in the world. You don‚Äôt need any coding or graphic designing experience. Simply download Figma on your laptop and learn the basics in just 45 minutes.

copy.heading: About Ansh
copy.content:
Ansh is a UX Designer & Storyteller at Zuddl, which is a virtual events hosting platform. He is a filmmaker turned engineer who eventually pursued UX Design.

As a student of Engineering, he represented his college at some of the most prestigious hackathons in the world, including hackMIT 2018 (held at Massachusetts Institute of Technology) and HackHarvard 2018 (held at Harvard University).

Out of hundreds of teams from 17 countries, Ansh and his team were one of the 12 Finalists at the Microsoft Imagine Cup Asia Regional Finals 2019, held at Sydney, Australia.

After college, he joined Zuddl as their first UX Designer. He was responsible to design Zuddl's entire MVP from scratch. As the product grew, Zuddl raised $2 Million in seed by YCombinator and $13.35M in their Series A.

attributes.title: How to Become a Freelance Artist
attributes.description: Join this workshop with Larisa where she‚Äôll share her experience on how she became a freelance artist. She‚Äôll give tips on how to build a career when you‚Äôre unsure of the first steps to take and how to stay relevant and consistent in your industry.

copy.heading: About Larisa
copy.content: Who has never dreamed of the moon? In December 2018 Larisa Murariu, a self-taught digital collage artist from Romania, has landed on it and if you trust her, her dreams are still from up there. Today Larisa‚Äôs personal ‚Äòmoon‚Äô has the same name and destiny: Morysetta, an astronaut of the imaginary. Her cosmic vision focuses on daily objects and common feelings just to turn them into something special, as magic as life is (and the moon itself). The secret of this great success is in the empathy behind every single collage: within them human emotions always find - drop after drop - a new place to be, without losing their truth. Rather they gain a deeper meaning: while crossing images they get into the essence of a thought, the pureness of a gesture, the source of an idea and - surprise! - no word is needed. Is this the power of the moon? This is the world of Morysetta.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Join this workshop with Larisa where she‚Äôll share her experience on how she became a freelance artist. She‚Äôll give tips on how to build a career when you‚Äôre unsure of the first steps to take and how to stay relevant and consistent in your industry.

attributes.description: This workshop focuses on navigating the creative world while balancing another career. Sam will talk about burnout, keeping up with instagram, making time to create and coming face to face with imposter syndrome while expanding his creative talents.

copy.heading: About Sam
copy.content: Sam is known for drawing fantastical places (and some real ones too) in pen, pencil and on his iPad. He has been drawing on family trips to England since he was about 5. Since then, he‚Äôs been enraptured by fantastical architecture,¬†hidden worlds and the shadow and light that makes up our world. In his first year of University, he transitioned into creating detailed sketches that he posted on Instagram, and since then has been creating¬†custom illustrations for lovely people and inspiring tattoo artists, musicians, clubs, publishing houses and engineering firms.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Our social feeds are full of stories about leaving day jobs behind and pursuing creative passions full time. But it‚Äôs possible to work full time while crafting a rewarding art practice on the side. This workshop focuses on navigating the creative world while balancing another career. Sam will talk about burnout, keeping up with instagram, making time to create and coming face to face with imposter syndrome while expanding his creative talents.

copy.content: For the month of July, Celina Rodriguez will be curating her version of "Summer Art School". With weekly themes and interactive activities, these workshops will be both something you can develop over the 4-week courses, AND/OR, something you can drop in for the hour! copy.heading: About Celina
copy.content: Celina Rodriguez a.k.a. ‚ÄúArt Mom‚Äù, is a multidisciplinary creative. With 11 years of experience in the music, fashion, and art industries, Celina is now working predominantly as a Creative Director focusing her work on highlighting BIPOC talents, artists, and visual storytelling. Her experiences both on and off set is what led to her founding the global art collective FM28.WORLDWIDE. Celina created FM28 to build an ‚Äúart family‚Äù, and community that like-minded artists could call home, work and grow within, and to contribute to strengthening and mentoring BIPOC communities and youth.

copy.heading: About Tabitha
copy.content:
Tabitha Swanson is a Berlin-based multi-disciplinary designer, creative technologist, and artist. Her practice includes 3D, animation, augmented reality, digital fashion, graphic design, and UX/UI.

Commercially, Tabitha has worked with brands including Vogue Germany, Nike, Highsnobiety, Reebok, Origins, and others to create beautiful work in the creative tech and design sphere.

Artistically, her work is used as a form of therapy, often composing questions rather than answers, and trying to faintly touch the unseen edges of human existence.

She has exhibited at Miami Art Basel, Transmediale, Mmmad, Cadaf Arts, and more.

attributes.title: Artpreneurship
attributes.description: Wether you have an MFA or are a self taught artist, this workshop will give you a solid overview of concepts and topics needed to turn your art practice into a viable business.¬† Get ready to learn everything art school didn't teach you and become knowledgeable of what you actually need to live off your work.

copy.heading: About Sofia
copy.content:
Sofia Zuluaga (Bogot√°, 1989) is an artist, teacher and director of WO Foundation Inc., an international nonprofit foundation focusing on advancing women's positioning in the art world. She has more than 5 years experience teaching classical painting and drawing at ateliers in Europe and Latin America and has since shifted focus to provide artists the tools and knowledge needed to thrive in their careers both through WO Foundation and independently. 



As an artist she has participated in the first exhibition by a Spanish museum dedicated to give visibility to the LGBT+ community (Una mirada LGTBI+ a la Colecci√≥n del MEAM, Museu Europeu D‚Äôart Modern), the first exhibition dedicated to contemporary women painters in Spain (Mujeres Artistas Hoy ‚Äô17, MEAM Museum), and an exhibition featuring the top international female figurative artists (Women Painting, All Over the World ‚Äò19, MEAM Museum). She has exhibited internationally in museums and galleries including the Museo Pablo Serrano (Zaragoza, Spain), Museu Europeu D‚Äôart Modern (Barcelona, Spain), Museo de la Caja Real (San Luis Potos√≠, Mexico), Museo Primer Deposito (Guanajuato, Mexico) and Museum of Now (Berlin, Germany). Her works have been selected as finalist in competitions such as Figurativas and ModPortrait. She currently resides in Spain.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content:
Wether you have an MFA or are a self taught artist, this workshop will give you a solid overview of concepts and topics needed to turn your art practice into a viable business.¬† Get ready to learn everything art school didn't teach you and become knowledgeable of what you actually need to live off your work.

We'll be discussing the things no one wants to talk about, (admin, admin, admin!) and provide you with tips and tools to make it as painless as possible and give you more time for creation.

copy.heading: About Andrea
copy.content: Andrea Orejarena (b. Colombia) is a U.S based artist. Her work employs the subversive power of play and fantasy to examine the American dream and ways media and technology influence our desire and agency. Her work has been shown at Vincom Center for Contemporary Art in Hanoi, Blow-Up Film Festival in Chicago, Museum of the Moving Image in NY, OLA Latino Film Festival in NY and Broken Screen Festival in Buenos Aires and published in articles by i-D Vice, It‚Äôs Nice That, Urbanautica, and Palm* Studios, among others.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: In this workshop, Andrea will give an overview of the relationship between photography and filmmaking. Andrea will draw on specific case studies to explore how the two mediums have influenced each other and co-developed. Andrea will also discuss how the blurring of the boundaries of mediums is a crucial aspect of her conceptual art practice.¬†There will be time at the end of the presentation for questions and comments which are always encouraged.

attributes.title: Learn the Basics of Mandala Art
attributes.description: From setting up a symmetry grid to the basics of shapes and patterns, this session will teach you everything you need to get started with your mandala art.

copy.heading: About Sophie
copy.content: Sophie founded Beetle Back Designs in 2015. Driven by the need for a creative outlet, she became deeply interested in mandala art at the start of her university studies. Using mandala art to help fund her way through university she came out the other end completely devoted to this art style and how it made her feel. After thousands of hours of practice and many projects later she has come to Daisie to share what she has learnt over the years.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content:
Mandala and rangoli patterns can be seen everywhere from relaxing colouring books to yoga studio walls, but have you ever wondered why? Mandalas use the principles of fractal patterns that the brain finds relaxing and meditative. Drawing them is also a form of art therapy that can be used to reduce stress, channel creativity, and boost your mood.

From setting up a symmetry grid to the basics of shapes and patterns, this session will teach you everything you need to get started with your mandala art.

copy.heading: Kit / Materials List
copy.content:
- Paper
- Pencil
- Eraser
- Ruler
- Compass
- Protractor
- Pens - fine liners work really well but any pen you have to hand can be used. If you really want to level up your design, having different sized fine liner nibs can really be effective.

copy.heading: About Ansh
copy.content:
Ansh is a UX Designer & Storyteller at Zuddl, which is a virtual events hosting platform. He is a filmmaker turned engineer who eventually pursued UX Design.

As a student of Engineering, he represented his college at some of the most prestigious hackathons in the world, including hackMIT 2018 (held at Massachusetts Institute of Technology) and HackHarvard 2018 (held at Harvard University).

Out of hundreds of teams from 17 countries, Ansh and his team were one of the 12 Finalists at the Microsoft Imagine Cup Asia Regional Finals 2019, held at Sydney, Australia.

After college, he joined Zuddl as their first UX Designer. He was responsible to design Zuddl's entire MVP from scratch. As the product grew, Zuddl raised $2 Million in seed by YCombinator and $13.35M in their Series A.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content:
Learn the absolute basics of UI Design along with a list of highly valuable resources that can help you kickstart your self taught UI Designer journey. No coding, no specific computer and no technical degree is required. You must know basics of Figma (watch our previous session) before attending this event

attributes.title: Golden Management Tips for Creatives
attributes.description: Graphic Designer Artist Linsey Sijmons is managed by Personal Brand Manager Karen Oldhoven. Working as a team and how to focus on your passion is what they do best¬†and will give you experiences, advice¬†on how to divide and¬†conquer the world as a team. As a bonus, they‚Äôll also give you advice on how to find management!

copy.heading: About Linsey
copy.content:
Art Director & Graphic Designer Linsey Sijmons is the Dutch artistic owner of House of Pose, creative studio for Instagram. Her gifted brain mixes worlds that make advertisers‚Äô content dreams come true; to make scroll stopping content.

With more than 10 years expertise in Art Direction and Graphic Design, her colorful personality is now a guest in Dutch National TV shows such as ‚Äòhet Perfecte Plaatje‚Äô. Her clientele include de Telegraaf, Quinny, Zalando, Rude Health, RTL, Bols Cocktails.

copy.heading: About Karen
copy.content: Do you have an account on a social platform? 95% chance that you will answer a resounding 'yes'. You unconsciously build your Personal Brand. Personal Branding Expert Karen Oldhoven is a speaker, moderator and has her own Personal Branding Agency. Enthusiastic whirlwind Karen advises and manages creative entrepreneurs and students to clarify and develop their Personal Brand, so that they feel more confident about their personality. The moment you, dear creator, know what you stand for, you deliver the right value to the person you do business with. Think of your future employer, customers and/or consumers. Karen has a background in media, starred in commercials, presented events and now speaks passionately about personal leadership, the era of human skills and personal development.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: As a creative, you want to focus on your talents on creating. The business side is not your strongest quality, yet you¬†know; it is a necessity¬†to pay your bills. Graphic Designer Artist Linsey Sijmons is managed by Personal Brand Manager Karen Oldhoven. Working as a team and how to focus on your passion is what they do best¬†and will give you experiences, advice¬†on how to divide and¬†conquer the world as a team. As a bonus, they‚Äôll also give you advice on how to find management!

attributes.title: How To Manage a Creative Business
attributes.description: In this workshop, George will present his experiences¬†building his creative studio, Greedy Goons, from a teenage art blog to his successful business and primary form of income. Using his career history as an example, he will discuss his thoughts regarding project management, self marketing, client communication, financial health and happiness!

copy.heading: About George
copy.content:
After quitting his BA in Illustration at the University of Brighton in 2015, George stumbled into the freelance creative world. Initially, taking on whatever jobs came his way before finally settling as a motion designer; teaching himself 2D & 3D technical skills entirely through Youtube. Working remotely at first with independent production companies through word-of-mouth, he eventually took the plunge and approached some creative studios, which led him to an internship-come-lead-motion-designer (over the space of almost 3 years) at the Electric Theatre Collective, ETC VFX.

Now leading his own studio, Greedy Goons, George divides his time in between creating commercial motion design and directorial projects within the music industry. Selected clients include: Adidas, Apple Music, Pepsi, Puma, EA, Ray-Ban, Sky, Sony Music & UMG. Aside from creating and directing, George also works as a mentor, where he not only supports people with their technical skills, but also tries to demystify the visual creative industries to make them more accessible and ultimately, more fun.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content:
In this workshop, George will present his experiences¬†building his creative studio, Greedy Goons, from a teenage art blog to his successful business and primary form of income.

Using his career history as an example, he will discuss his thoughts regarding project management, self marketing, client communication, financial health and happiness!

George wouldn't call himself an expert business owner, but he‚Äôs definitely learnt a lot along the way that he'd like to share with the Daisie community.

As always, please come with questions!

attributes.title: Responsive Web and App Design on Figma
attributes.description: Learn how designers create responsive user interfaces on Figma using Constraints. This skillset will allow you to design and ship UI that works well across multiple screen sizes.

copy.heading: About Ansh
copy.content:
Ansh is a UX Designer & Storyteller at Zuddl, which is a virtual events hosting platform. He is a filmmaker turned engineer who eventually pursued UX Design.

As a student of Engineering, he represented his college at some of the most prestigious hackathons in the world, including hackMIT 2018 (held at Massachusetts Institute of Technology) and HackHarvard 2018 (held at Harvard University).

Out of hundreds of teams from 17 countries, Ansh and his team were one of the 12 Finalists at the Microsoft Imagine Cup Asia Regional Finals 2019, held at Sydney, Australia.

After college, he joined Zuddl as their first UX Designer. He was responsible to design Zuddl's entire MVP from scratch. As the product grew, Zuddl raised $2 Million in seed by YCombinator and $13.35M in their Series A.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content:
Learn how designers create responsive user interfaces on Figma using Constraints. This skillset will allow you to design and ship UI that works well across multiple screen sizes. You must know basics of Figma (watch our previous session) before attending this event.

‚ö°Ô∏è Topics we will cover:

üëâüèª What is Responsive Design?

üëâüèª How do you use Constraints in Figma?

üëâüèª Resources to learn Responsive Design on your own.

üëâüèª Tips and tricks to learn UI Design the right way.

attributes.title: Floral Impasto Painting
attributes.description: In this workshop, Angela will demonstrate how to create a floral impasto painting.

copy.heading: About Angela
copy.content:
Angela Wells is a multidisciplinary artist based out of British Columbia, Canada. Her work ranges from colourful impasto paintings to single line tattoos. She has been working as a full time artist for the last two years, and has recently been filming her impasto painting process to create short but captivating videos.

Her artistic process begins with drawing inspiration from the things around her; it can be as simple as a flower growing in her garden or as abstract as a feeling based on a memory. She enjoys using a lot of paint, layering it on canvas with palette knives and using piping bags to manipulate it like frosting.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: In this workshop, Angela will demonstrate how to create a floral impasto painting. Impasto is a painting technique where paint is laid on a surface in thick layers, typically by using a palette knife or brush. She will share tips and tricks she has learned over the years, as well as create an original painting for you to watch or follow along with her!

copy.heading: ART MOM PRESENTS: JULY SUMMER SCHOOL 2022
copy.content: For the month of July, Celina Rodriguez will be curating her version of "Summer Art School". With weekly themes and interactive activities, these workshops will be both something you can develop over the 4-week courses, AND/OR, something you can drop in for the hour! The idea is to have fun and get back to summer creation. Enjoy!

copy.heading: About Celina
copy.content: Celina Rodriguez a.k.a. ‚ÄúArt Mom‚Äù, is a multidisciplinary creative. With 11 years of experience in the music, fashion, and art industries, Celina is now working predominantly as a Creative Director focusing her work on highlighting BIPOC talents, artists, and visual storytelling. Her experiences both on and off set is what led to her founding the global art collective FM28.WORLDWIDE. Celina created FM28 to build an ‚Äúart family‚Äù, and community that like-minded artists could call home, work and grow within, and to contribute to strengthening and mentoring BIPOC communities and youth.

copy.heading: About Talina
copy.content: Talina is a printmaker and illustrator from Switzerland. In 2020 during the first covid lockdown she discovered her passion for lino cutting. a few months later she started selling her prints and it all started from there. Soon after, she started printing on shirts, tote bags and more. Talina gets her inspiration from music, quotes, places she has been or misses and her own feelings. In her work, it‚Äòs all about mental health, self-care and taking care of each other. Passing on her collected knowledge and experience is very important to Talina, which is why she started hosting workshops with kids in schools. She loves seeing what everyone creates.

attributes.title: Live Demo: Letterpress Printing
attributes.description: In this workshop, Michelle (Nice & Graphic) will take us on a detailed and step-by-step demonstration of how to create handmade letterpress prints.

copy.heading: About Michelle
copy.content:
Michelle is a London-based graphic designer and the founder of Nice & Graphic who uses traditional, hand-printing techniques to create bold, modern designs. 

Nice & Graphic is a specialist producer of beautiful greetings cards, hand designed and printed using a vintage Vandercook Press, letterpress printed in a bold minimalist design.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Letterpress is a type of relief printing that uses carved wood blocks of different typefaces, carefully arranged and set by hand, inked, and pressed onto the paper. In this workshop, Michelle (Nice & Graphic) will take us on a detailed and step-by-step demonstration of how to create handmade letterpress prints.

sections.name: topImage
sections.caption: Learn how to Letterpress with Michelle!

learnContent.title: Learn All About Letterpress
learnContent.description: Letterpress is a type of relief printing that uses carved wood blocks of different typefaces, carefully arranged and set by hand, inked, and pressed onto the paper. Michelle will also be covering a brief history of the printing industry.

learnContent.title: The Printing Process
learnContent.description: Michelle will explain how letterpress printing is entirely different from digital printing. The workshop will explore how hand-rolled ink produces bold, rich colours and a tactile look that is unique to each print.

learnContent.title: Live Demo
learnContent.description: Michelle will be demonstrating the printing process and explaining all the tools necessary, filling negative space, inking the rollers, aligning the paper, test printing and doing final prints.

learnContent.title: Extra Resources
learnContent.description: At the end of the session, Michelle will share resources about how to learn more about letter-pressing.

In this workshop, Michelle will be explaining and demonstrating the letterpress printing process!

copy.heading: About Jimbo
copy.content: Jimbo Bernaus is an accomplished hand lettering artist and graphic designer, Jimbo is most known for the powerful colour palettes and clever design techniques he uses to demonstrate mastery of the form. Many of his pieces are accented with floral embellishments, a design motif that has captured the attention of thousands across social media. Today, the Croatia-based designer is the co-founder of¬†BAM! Creative Studio¬†(also known as¬†ShoutBam¬†on Instagram), which specialises in letter crafting, illustration and digital and educational products¬†to help amateur letterers enhance their skills.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: In this workshop you'll learn the art of composition for your lettering pieces with a highly comprehensive method that will hold your hand from beginning to end. We will start by choosing a quote, study the word hierarchy and structure and finally choosing letter styles, making a grid and come up with the final layout.

attributes.title: What Is web3 & Crypto, And Why it Matters
attributes.description: Join Tom for a deep dive into the history of cryptocurrencies and learn why so many smart people are so excited about crypto and web3, the next iteration of the internet. We‚Äôll cover some fundamentals about blockchains, decentralisation, Bitcoin, Ethereum, smart contracts and more.

copy.heading: About Tom
copy.content: Tom Glendinning is a content creator, multi-disciplinary artist and educator. He creates content for music makers as ELPHNT (where he has over 70k YouTube subscribers) and has been teaching Ableton Live as an Ableton Certified Trainer for 10+ years. Tom creates digital art and explores web3 under the Polyforms alias.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content:
You‚Äôve probably heard plenty about crypto and web3. Some things good, some bad. But what is it all about and why should you care?

Join Tom for a deep dive into the history of cryptocurrencies and learn why so many smart people are so excited about crypto and web3, the next iteration of the internet. We‚Äôll cover some fundamentals about blockchains, decentralisation, Bitcoin, Ethereum, smart contracts and more.

For a more practical guide on getting started in web3, join us for Part 2 of this series where Tom will cover everything you need to know to start your web3 journey.

attributes.title: Photographing Animals
attributes.description: In this workshop, Andrea will discuss different strategies for photographing animals.

copy.heading: About Andrea
copy.content: Andrea Orejarena (b. Colombia) is a U.S based artist. Her work employs the subversive power of play and fantasy to examine the American dream and ways media and technology influence our desire and agency. Her work has been shown at Vincom Center for Contemporary Art in Hanoi, Blow-Up Film Festival in Chicago, Museum of the Moving Image in NY, OLA Latino Film Festival in NY and Broken Screen Festival in Buenos Aires and published in articles by i-D Vice, It‚Äôs Nice That, Urbanautica, and Palm* Studios, among others.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: In this workshop, Andrea will discuss different strategies for photographing animals and capturing their inner psychology with playfulness, a sense of humor, and sensitivity. Specific case studies will be reviewed as a launching point for a group discussion. Participants are encouraged to bring their own work on the subject for a group session portfolio review after Andrea's presentation.

attributes.title: Practicing Portraiture
attributes.description: In this workshop with Rachel, you will learn techniques to practice painting portraitures in different mediums.

copy.heading: About Rachel
copy.content: Rachel Christopoulos is an acrylic artist in Madison, WI. Her work is created from a place of pure curiosity and a passion for color, individuality, and word play. She often describes herself as an old soul, coffee connoisseur, and a dreamer (though she's not the only one). Though she paints a variety of subjects, her artwork focuses on blending the familiar with new ideas and bright colors to create an individualistic play on everyday scenes.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: In this workshop we'll talk about building up a regular habit of practicing portraiture in different mediums, how to build skill, and begin to breakdown and paint features in real time.

copy.heading: About Kelsee
copy.content: Kelsee Thomas is an illustrator, content creator, and multi-hyphenate originally from the Midwest and now is based in Los Angeles. Her focus is mainly on making colorful illustrative work of all kinds, but she‚Äôs also constantly learning whether it be a new artistic skill or how to navigate as a freelancer and is ready to share her findings!

attributes.title: How To Create Magical Images Using Composites
attributes.description: Join this workshop to Learn how to create magical fine art composite images with Ashraful!

copy.heading: About Ashraful
copy.content: Ashraful Arefin is a fine art photographer born and based in the same city. Ashraful was photographically born in 2013 when he started doing a 365 photography project, and completely fell in love with photography and found his true passion for it. After completing his Bachelors in Fine Arts from the Faculty of Fine Arts, University of Dhaka, he decided to dedicate his full time to photography. Ashraful always wanted to create something that‚Äôs meaningful to others and that's what he wants to continue doing. Within his photographic frame, Ashraful tries to show the beauty of ordinary moments which are often ignored in plain sight. He tries to capture a moment that allows the viewers to see the regular world as a place to dream, to appreciate the simple beautiful moments around us.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Ashraful will explore all the techniques necessary to creating a composite image. Including explaining lighting, expanding, taking multiple shots etc.

learnContent.title: Capturing Composite Images
learnContent.description: Ashraful will explore all the necessary techniques to creating a composite image. Including explaining lighting, expanding, taking multiple shots etc.

learnContent.title: Behind The Scenes
learnContent.description: In addition to all the components in front of the camera, Ashraful will also explain the behind the camera components that are essential to creating composite images.

learnContent.title: Editing in Photoshop
learnContent.description: Whilst capturing the image is a major component of composite images, the editing plays a large role. Ashraful will go through all the technical procedures necessary to create the magical image. Including stitching images, color grading and more.

sentences: Ashraful Arefin is a fine art photographer known for his magical composite images. Ashraful tries to show the beauty of ordinary moments which are often ignored in plain sight.
His images capture the moment that allows the viewers to see the regular world as a place to dream, to appreciate the simple beautiful moments around us.
In this workshop, Ashraful will guide and demonstrate to us how he creates his magical images.

copy.heading: About Caleb
copy.content: Caleb Stein (b. UK) is a U.S. based multimedia artist whose work explores the fragility of memory and the dynamic, energetic interactions that take place within community. With an industry-spanning and impressive career, his extensive accolades include: exhibitions in the Palm* Photo Prize at Photo London and Photo Vogue Festival at Base Milano; publications in i-D Vice, Dazed and Vogue Italia; and is also working on a book for 'Long Time No See' (2018-2020) in collaboration with video artist Andrea Orejarena and book designer Brian Paul Lamotte.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: In this workshop, Daisie participants are invited to share their work with Caleb in a group portfolio review. Particular attention will be placed on how to strengthen individual images, how to produce a body of work, and how to get that work published and out in the world.

attributes.title: How To Navigate The Entertainment Industry
attributes.description: Join Jillian as she shares how to handle rejection in the entertainment industry and how to stay positive.

copy.heading: About Jillian
copy.content:
Jillian Shea Spaeder is an actress and singer-songwriter who starred in the Disney + original film *Godmothered* and performs two songs on the movie‚Äôs soundtrack. She is known primarily for her lead role as Bailey on the Disney XD series *Walk the Prank.*
Jillian got her start singing and playing the piano when she was five years old, discovered her love of guitar at 12, and has released more than 10 songs, including the theme song for Brat TV‚Äôs ‚ÄúCrazy Fast‚Äù, which she co-wrote. Jillian also co-wrote and co-directed the video for her song, ‚ÄúSomething Better‚Äù, which won best video in several film festivals. She started her acting career with several roles in regional musical theater, then moved to California to enter the film and television industry after meeting her manager during a trip to Hollywood.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Join Jillian as she shares how to handle rejection in the entertainment industry and how to stay positive. Creating your own work, and a routine for yourself can be a very effective way to do this. She will also share some tips on how you can advance your career on your own. This workshop is open to all creatives, especially those exploring the performing arts.

attributes.title: Level up Your Illustrations: Exploring Colour and Composition
attributes.description: In this class you will learn how to apply the basics composition and colour theory to your own art as Viktoria walks you through her creative process.

copy.heading: About Viktoria
copy.content: Viktoria is a self-taught Illustrator based in Berlin, Germany. Her art focuses on animal illustrations that are both cute and colourful as well as educational. Along with her Instagram she also runs a sticker shop on Etsy and a successful Patreon, where her followers have the chance to take a look behind the scenes of a small business. Her work is known for the use of vibrant colours and clear shapes. Her favourite mediums to use are acrylic paint markers and acrylic gouache. Her artistic process starts from the ground up, with a deep understanding of anatomy that inject her art with realism even while the vivid colours seem to pop of the page.

copy.heading: The Session
copy.content: Viktoria (@vaulchenart) is known for her colourful animal illustrations. In this class you will learn how to apply the basics composition and colour theory to your own art as she walks you through her creative process. By sharing the different stages to her illustrative process and taking you through them in real time, you will leave the class with a process that can be applied to your own art, no matter the medium and subject matter.

learnContent.title: Composition
learnContent.description: Learn how to choose the right elements to combine in order to create a put together balanced outcome.

learnContent.title: Color Theory
learnContent.description: Explore the techniques to mix the correct colours in order to create a striking illustrations.

learnContent.title: Process
learnContent.description: By sharing the different stages to Viktoria's illustrative process and taking you through them in real time, you will leave the class with a process that can be applied to your own art, no matter the medium and subject matter.

sentences: Viktoria (@vaulchenart) is a self-taught Illustrator based in Berlin, Germany. Her art focuses on animal illustrations that are both cute and colourful as well as educational.
Her work is known for the use of vibrant colours and clear shapes using primarily acrylic paint markers and acrylic gouache.
In this workshop, you will learn the necessary steps to elevate your illustrations.
